Reviews.Title: “nice location hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. room a bit on the small side with not a very nice outlook but not a problem as so much to see and do in amsterdam.nice location for trams and lots of bars and resturants very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - decent value”
Reviews.Author: Bali888
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. Just opposite from the world famous Leidse Plein. 150 meters from the Vodel Park. The Standard room for one person is not large, but enough. One twin bed. There is a small fridge with plenty space for extra drinks etc. The bathroom is very neat and clean. You need to call the reception to have someone turn of the heater. Thermostat does not link to the heater.

Reviews.Title: “Central and easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: Stordalen
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the city of Amsterdam within walking distance to shopping and sightseeing. An excellent location if YouÂ´re "doing" Amsterdam in a couple of days. Easily accessible when arriving at Schipol Airport - just over 30 minutes with shuttle bus 197 to Leidseplein - which is just across the street from the hotel. Fare cost â‚¬ 4,- Well equipped and comfortable rooms - a little small however. Cooling unit out of order a let down, as it got quite warm at night. (If this had been working, sleeping conditions would have been very good). Quiet, even though my room was facing the street. Quick, but polite check-in and out. Breakfast buffet with decent variety served until 1030.

Reviews.Title: “Just how did this place get som many good reviews?”
Reviews.Author: jaffam
Reviews.Content: This place is soulless and awful. â‚¬18 for 24hr internet access, â‚¬15 to use the gym with it's equipment from the 20th century (I walked out and went for a walk), the rooms are like shacking up in a prison block and the service is distinctly average. This is the sort of place that fuels the rise of services like Air BNB and after all this who cares about the location. I really don't mind paying for stuff. It should just be a WHOLE lot better than this. Oh did I mention the A/C doesn't work either?

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but hotel smells funny.”
Reviews.Author: Miss-Travel-Bandit
Reviews.Content: The staff was really nice but that cute red couch in the lobby has stains on it. The carpet in the halls was also stained. Some of the numbers that point to which direction your room is, were missing. The bedding was clean, as were the towels. The bed was really sunk in the middle, it was not comfortable at all. The plus is that this hotel is close to everything! We walked to Anne Frank, Van Gogh, I amsterdam sign, the hard rock, a casino and plenty of local shops including an H&M.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Bring Cleaning Products”
Reviews.Author: joes b
Reviews.Content: The staff were great and the location was terrific, but mother-of-god that place was a level 5 bio-lab petry dish. We had a great view of the city, but had to open to dirt caked windows to see it. The floors were black with dirt (soot or cig smoke??) and can be seen easily if you wash a bit of the floor with a towel like we did. WOW. I actually made a video of us cleaning it. So gross. Wouldn't have bothered me so much but I had my young daughter with me play on the floors. And finally, when leaving, we learned that we had to pay an 80 Euro 'Tourist Tax'. WTF man! Never heard of such a thing, and 80 Euros! Great location, but I would take a chance on some other place in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location, but it was soooo DIRTY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with the good points. Staff were excellent at the front desk, very helpful with directions and recommendations throughout our stay. The hotel is in a perfect location...right in the heart of the city without being too close to the loud bars at night. Now for the not so good... When I booked a surperior room, it was supposed to come with a balcony which their superior rooms don't have. I travel 8 -10 times a year on business and have stayed at 50+ 4 star hotels and this is by far the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at. When we entered our room the first thing we noticed was the dust on the floor - our friends down the hall noticed the same thing. We asked that day to have the floors (hard woods) cleaned but when we got back it was clear that they only did a partial job - cleaning in front of the TV and couch and not near the bed or in the washroom. To check it, I threw a glass off water on the floor and wiped it up with a towel - it was black with dirt. So not only was the floor dusty it was actually dirty. I have a baby crawling around so I actually cleaned the floor myself with the towels. All the furniture was dirty as well, with crumbs and stains on every seat and bed. I didn't feel comfortable there and most likely will stay somewhere else next time. Shame as the place has a lot of potential. ...and although I paid upfront through a website when I checked out there was an extra "city tax" that I had to pay.

Reviews.Title: “OK...so it a business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: milesfish
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Amsterdam annually for about a dozen years. I keep returning to the NH Centre, a business hotel. I teach in Italy during the summer and spend time in Amsterdam before returning to the states. So I'm not your typical "business" traveler. But for me, the location is just right: between Liedesplein and Museumplein. Like most business hotels the breakfast is way overpriced (but this one is good). The Superior are usually worth the difference. Staff is always great. The WiFi protocol in the lobby remains a little stupid and a waste of time for all of us. But the hotel overall is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveller569
Reviews.Content: Stayed Easter weekend and arrived early fri morning, check in was smooth and quick with an upgrade to an apartment but then found that I was booked in as someone else although handing over my passport, this was rectified although they did say that my reservation was not listed. Hotel was in a Prime location with easy access to every part and transport. Breakfast although seems expensive was well worth a visit for the one morning over our weekend for its variety and quality! Rooms were amazingly clean and even and towels replaced daily. small altercation on check out as we had been charged for other breakfasts that we had not had, although this again was eventually rectified the hotel food manager was adamant we had had the food on both mornings when I asked for CCTV footage and also it was clearly no one in my party of 3s signature she then sent staff out to see if they has seen us. This was the hotels only main flaw but would overwise Highly recommend this hotel and will be staying in other NH hotels and certainly revisiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Your standard hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mnk_BC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of April. When we first checked in we were put in a room on the second floor that backed onto the elevators. When we came back in from a walk, there was a grinding sound in the walls whenever the elevators went up and down. We asked to switch rooms and the staff were very helpful. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. If you are looking for your standard, no frills, business hotel in a great location, this on fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: oasistrop1
Reviews.Content: NH is a very good brand and this hotel is in a great location, a short walk from the Leidseplein, the museums and the trams. For me the advantage is that you are near it , but not in it ( lots is going on in the (leidseplein ) and much closer to the wonderful neighborhoods of an incredible city. The City Centre is a short hop on the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: candace d
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Amsterdam and I must say this hotel was amazing. Upon checking in, the process was quick and smooth. The front desk receptionists were fantastic, efficient and more than helpful to assist me locate a bike tour company in the area. Our hotel room was super clean, spacious and comfortable with a great view of the canal across the street. We recieved fresh towels daily during our 3 night stay wihch can be a rareity. This hotel is located near several restaurants, cafes, coffeeshops and most importantly a short walk to miles of endless shopping. Everything is in walking distance... museum district, redlight district, rembrant square, tulip markets, canals, souvenir shops, churches, monuments and starbucks :). We arrived by the ICE train which is less than a 10 minute taxi ride to the hotel and Schipol airport was a 20 minute taxi ride during morning rush hour.. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel...Awesome Location....great value”
Reviews.Author: monsta2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with my brother. Booked through Priceline, Paying about Â£170 for our three night stay, Asked for a twin room with a view on arrival and was granted with one, with the helpful staff saying there would be one available shortly. The room was extremely clean and the service was flawless. Despite me being a tad messy, returned to the room each night with my mess tidied up ;-) I noticed even the cups/glasses were replaced on a daily basis which i thought was kinda handy, A bonus was that the room had a security safe (free to use), which i didnt expect at all. The location of the hotel is as highlighted one of its key selling points....a tram stop directly outside and a short walk to the Leidesplein. Bit surprised at fellow reviewers saying this hotel is only worth it at the priceline rate. Have you guys seen the prices of accomodation in Amsterdam!!! A tatty hostel (which we wouldnt have considered) would have set us back Â£25+ each in a similiar location. But yeah 120E (standard price) is also too much. The only issue I have is that some of the extra services are overpriced- e.g. breakfast, fitness centre, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyTasteHisTaste
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this NH and the NH city Amsterdam. This NH feels more like a business hotel, more modern and efficient. + service, space in the room, iron in the room.\ - bed too soft (spring), shower in bathtub and bathtub is too high to climb into (not for people with knee problem) feels rather dangerous when wet. Will return if they have a harder bed that does not move like waterbed when two persons sleep in it.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: gkarase
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay in the specific hotel. I keep on choosing that mainly because of the location. Still the service and hotel facilities are probably overrated for the price you have to pay, especially with regard to other hotels nearby. Two out of three times I had minor issues with the front desk services. Once because they could not find my reservation and the second time because although I wanted only to order a taxi, the lobby personnel told me I had to wait 30 minutes in the check out queue. Finally I got out of the hotel, went to the hotel around the corner and ordered a taxi from there. Be aware that the check out queue in the morning might be very long. Some rooms are quite small, but this is Amsterdam, right? Breakfast was ok. The hotel location is quite convenient. Internet service was too expensive

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Jmims
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay here. The room was super clean and a decent size, and the decor was modern, warm and inviting. There was a couch in front of the bed that was great for watching television on. The lobby was nicely decorated. The staff members were all friendly. The value for money was good (did a priceline bid, paid somewhere between 75 or 85USD, I think) but I'm not sure if that would be the case if one paid full price. My one complaint is that the internet vouchers only went for half an hour, after which you had to pick up another one from the front desk: kind of a waste of paper.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: RafaelSabbagh
Reviews.Content: Although the room was ok and hotel is not bad, staff was unfriendly and they charge you just about everything other hotels will give you for free. So you only get free Internet at the lobby, and even if you pay for their expensive Internet to use in your room, you cannot use it for Skype (at least not for more than a few minutes), because the ammount of data you can upload is ridiculously limited. Also, you have to pay 15 euros a day to use the fitness center. Not comming back!

Reviews.Title: “Still Good not as great as in the past”
Reviews.Author: Matti T
Reviews.Content: My last visit was in late 2007 at which time I would have said the hotel is great. This time, although the staff was still very friendly and the service was overall very good, the rooms are in need of some maintenance (the showerhead is in need of replacement - room #431) and the replacement room suggested did not seem to offer much of an improvement. Overall, still recommended, but needs to do betterâ€¦ Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay made even better by the staff”
Reviews.Author: cumbrianmale
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this hotel. This time the room was smaller without a view but as it was a priceline booking and there was a major convention on in the RAI and the hotel was full at the start of our stay it was to be expected. Prior to arriving I had emailed the hotel to order flowers for my wifes birthday. Not only was this arranged and delivered as requested the hotel gave us a bottle of Prosecco. The flowers were very good quality roses and exceptional value. The highlight was when we went out for dinner and arrived back they had made a big rose petal heart on the bed. Big brownie points with the Mrs and a total surprise, unfortunately didn't get a photo as it got a bit messed up. I have no hesitation recommending the hotel. It is a great location with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, however there was a major security breach!”
Reviews.Author: misssyd
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to purchase a few nights at the NH Amsterdam Centre on priceline for US$69 a night. A bargain in our minds and so close to Amsterdam city! We caught the tram from Centraal station to the hotel, which is located opposite a tram stop! Brilliant for getting around! Check in went like a breeze until we entered our room. We started to unpack a few things and my husband went to use the toilet. It wasn't long that we noticed that there was a laptop, luggage and even marrijuana in the toilet! We were somehow given a room already in use and they still had all their stuff still in it!!! Luckily they weren't IN the room when we entered, otherwise it would have been terribly embarassing! We advised the hotel staff immediately and they apologised profusely for their mistake. We were then UPGRADED to the most amazing suite! Needless to say we had a fantastic stay, albeit always being cautious to lock up all of our stuff in case of another 'mistake'.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: twist27
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again. The only difference between this stay and the last was that my room seemed slightly smaller but not much and this time there was no bathrobe or slippers provided ( no great hardship but I thought that was a nice touch ). Apart from that my original revue ( see below ) still stands http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g188590-d275406-r30069314-NH_Amsterdam_Centre-Amsterdam_Noord_Holland.html

Reviews.Title: “Try it on Priceline.com for $75 a night, otherwise it is expensive”
Reviews.Author: pbirdie3
Reviews.Content: Upscale 4 star hotel next to Leidespelin Square were all the action is. Rooms well appointed, clean and up to date. Front desk staff, some were very, very nice and others not so much. Rather expensive, try Priceline.com, city center area, and we got it for $75 a night. They may not put you in the best room because of it, but who is ever in their room much in Europe. Room was very, very nice. Had an issue with the wind throught the window and making a sound in the vent at night. Put a towel in the window and closed it to stop the noise. Free Wifi in the lobby only. Would stay here again for the location and restaurants and nightlife, but only at the price we got it for.

Reviews.Title: “thanks to the whole staff of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danila C Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted to thank the personnel of the hotel NH Amsterdam Centre Stadhouderskade 7, Amsterdam 1054 ESs for the help that you have given us the comfort and the patience that have had with us. A thanks special it goes to Stefania Fucci that she works in the kitchen and to Ferdinand the barman...! A thanks also to the manager! An embrace dall' Italy Samantha and Danila.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: 2Traverlers
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for New Years and were not able to locate the hotel right away because the sign is so small. We saw the Marriot sign first thing and didn't notice the sign for this hotel at all. The hotel is right across the street from the Marriot. Check in was good. WIFI is not free in room but it is free in lobby and they do have a business computer. You are also able to print your boarding pass for free which is a plus. The room was just okay but the shower is awesome. Love the shower!!! The TV is an old tube TV and the bed was not very comfortable for me but okay for my husband. The towels in the bathroom are great, big and soft. We had a view of Leids Square from our room which is nice. The hotel is walking distance to city center, musems, heneiken brewery, flower market, Ann Frank Haus and several other sights. We took the tram but you can walk to these locations from the hotel. The Tram is so close and easy to use. 7,00 EURO for a 24 hour pass. The service at the hotel was wonderful. We asked for restaurant suggestions for New Years Eve and the Night Manager went above and beyond to find a place for us to eat. Most places are closed in Amsterdam for New Years Eve and she called around till she found something for us. I would recommend this hotel due to the location and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Convienient”
Reviews.Author: agedude
Reviews.Content: Fine business class hotel located just across the canal from the Leidseplein entertainment district. 5 minutes walk from the Rijksmuseum, 7 to the Van Gogh, and 10 to the Concertgebouw. Polite and helpful staff. Rooms are on the smallish side, but nicely appointed and comfortable. Nice decor and comfortable beds. Bathroom was also smallish with no tub, but a large walk-in shower with a double shower head (pretty weak water pressure). There is only a single elevator to take you to your rooms and its room key card reader allowing access is pretty old and takes several attempts to read. Easy access to and from the central train station as the #1 tram stops right in front of the hotel. The Blue Boat canal cruise dock is only a couple of minutes down the block. Nothing special, but pleasant. You won't be overwhelmed nor disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit "cold" hotel on the best location”
Reviews.Author: doktor24
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on the best possible location in Amsterdam, 15 min walking distance to "everything" (Dam square, Rembrandt, shopping areas...) and well connected with public transport. Unfortunatelly, this is one of those hotels where everything is OK, but nothing is exceptional - something is still missing to make it place to love it... Hotel service is not as expected, and staff make a little bit "cold" atmosphere. Rooms are generally OK, but I don't understand that they din not change TV during renovation of the rooms!? Wireless is free only in the lobby but they allow maximum of 8 users at time so very hard to connect during breakfast. Breakfast is nothing more than average. I stayed during exhibition and paid high rate of 200â‚¬/night - in regular time this hotel definitely is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Small things let this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSue
Reviews.Content: My first impressions were that this is a pretty-much-same-as-all-the-rest bland, corporate hotel to stay on business. The bedroom was generally fine, the reception staff were fine, it's in a good central location. Overall though, I have to say I just didn't like this place. I found the room and corridors dark and overly hot - and I couldn't seem to find a way to get my room any cooler. The food I ordered on room service was just horrible. It looked as if it had come straight out of the microwave, was bordering on cold, had a weird side salad thrown on the side with no dressing, and was way overpriced. I thought the wireless internet charge was also high. Those things tipped me over from thinking 'bland, faceless hotel but nothing really wrong with it' to thinking 'overpriced and didn't like'. Next time I'll stay somewhere else. Tip: Give the room service a miss.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat location and value”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: hotel is just across the street of one of the major squares in Amsterdam, where one can find tons of restaurants and bars of all kind. book a (rock-)concert in the notorious venues "melkweg" and/or "paradiso" and scroll to bed afterwards. furthermore it's a great place from where one can easily explore the city by foot. check in may take a few minutes and standard rooms are on the small side, but if you can get a room with view towards the square, that should compensate. standard rooms fit 2 people only (no additional kids). rooms are clean and offer woodden floors, tea/coffee facilities, minibar, safe and an old tv with only 30 or some channels. mattrasses are soft. bathroom with a shower is also rather small and offers a hairdrier and some shower products. bar- and restaurant area are fine and look very inviting. overall if you don't mind the somewhat stained floorcovering in the hallways, I guess 3,5 stars are adequate. this hotel offers a good value and fantastic location in an expensive city. I would always stay here again, just to mention: Amsterdam is different.

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary ever”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: The NH Amsterdam Centre Hotel is perfectly located in the city centre. The rooms are spacious and clean and the breakfast buffet caters for everyone and is just delicious. The staff could not be more helpful and they made our wedding anniversary absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to pretty much everything you want to see in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: AGuyFromHawaii
Reviews.Content: Great location. We walked to the Van Gogh Museum, Leidseplein, Vondel Park, Heineken Experience, Red Light District/Asian Neighborhood all in one afternoon/night. Rooms are modern, well-sized, and clean. Only thing is that free wifi is only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Simon_Birt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night on a work trip. It is very well located, easy to get to from the airport. I had a room on the 6th floor and although it was a nice room, it was rather smelly. Maybe they had some issues with the sewage, I reported this to reception, they said they were going to investigate and fix the problem. After coming back from a night out the smell was still there and nobody seemed to know that the was a problem at all. Breakfast is good

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: YUL_72
Reviews.Content: NH Amsterdam is a very good place to stay in Amsterdam. They got friendly and helpful staff. Place is so near from every night life there. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “NH standard quality has been confirmed!”
Reviews.Author: Paoletor
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the well known NH quality standards: my room was big and conformable with modern looking furniture. Also the level of all the services was high. In particular the personnel was very professional and kind. The breakfast was very good (although not the richest ever seen). We found the location very practical both for business and leisure. For example it is possible to reach most of the attraction areas by tram or even by walking. Also the surroundings of the hotel are good for the nightlife and entrainment (it is full of restaurants and pubs) and the Van Gogh museum is 10 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Bargain, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dhailia
Reviews.Content: Bagged this hotel through Priceline for about Â£50 a night for a twin room. Although a bit away from the centre, the hotel is located right next to Vondel Park, and the Van Gogh and Riksmuseum . The area is great for finding places to eat, shops and for pottering about, seeing the sights. Amsterdam city centre really isn't that big and walking in from the Hotel to the Train Station took only about 20 mins. I would recommend asking for a room on the upper floors, as it is quieter and there is a better view. We were lucky enough to get a little outside balcony area too. The room and bathroom was immaculate. The room itself was large, the air con worked well and the black-out curtains made it a little too easy to sleep in. My only complaints would be; the bed wasn't firm enough for me, and i ended up with a sore back from having slept sunk into the mattress. I was disappointed there was no UHT milk in the in-room drinks supply- Creamer just isn't the same in a cuppa. I'm not sure if they were training up new staff or what, but at reception it took AGES for anyone to serve us. We waited about 15-20mins at the desk waiting to check in. The check in desk wasn't busy either, it was just us and two American gentlemen who were served before us, despite coming up to the desk about 5 mins after we'd started waiting. All in all for the price we paid- an absolute bargain! When i go back, i'd be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen1000
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to Amsterdam we love to stay in leidseplein so this hotel was perfect for us. Trams 1, 2 or 5 will get you to Leidseplein square from Central Station and then the hotel is just a 2min walk from there. Leidseplein is great at any time of year especially summer,lots of great restaurants to sit outside and it's a great base to get sightseeing. The room was a good size for us, comfortable bed,room seemed clean but I was walking around in bare feet on the wooden floor and found my feet ended up filthy so the floor needs a good wash! Bathroom was clean though. Didn't have breakfast here so can't comment but the bar was nice and usually quite busy. All in all another great stay in Amsterdam! :) We hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60763Nancy
Reviews.Content: Near Leidesplein Square, very good location, close to bike rental and Vondelpark, which is great for riding, very good breakfast, nice gym facilities (extra cost) internet in lobby only and little slow, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Yadys S
Reviews.Content: Well this time my visit to AMS was all about party and this hotel was perfectly situated on few steps from Leidseplein!! Also on a nice stroll to the Dam Square, promise not far!! Rooms are very nice and big, perfect for a night or to of a nice bed to sleep in! :) Great if you are coming thru centraal station there is a direct tram sttoping right infront the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABZGIRL
Reviews.Content: I have never wrote a review before, but I felt I should share my experience at NH Amsterdam Centre. First thing is to make sure you do not get this hotel, NH Amsterdam Centre, mixed up with NH Amsterdam City Centre. The 'City Centre' hotel is no where near as high quality or as well located as the 'Centre'. NH Amsterdam Centre is in a perfect location, directly across from the main restaurant/bar area and a 10 minute walk to other main attractions such as Dam Square, The Dungeons, Central Station etc. The hotel is beautifully decorated, right from the lobby to the hotel rooms. The rooms are small (the same in every hotel in Amsterdam), but perfectly arranged. Bed was very comfortable. The cleanliness of the rooms can not be faulted. We accidentally left out 'Do not Disturb' sign on our hotel room door, and came back that evening to find a bag full of toiletries, towels etc left on our door handle. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We arrived to check in at 1pm, and even though they could not check us in until 3pm (as stated at time of booking), the staff still took our luggage off of us and kept it safe so we could have a look around Amsterdam instead of either sitting and waiting two hours to check in or dragging our luggage around the city. I have stayed in a few hotels in Amsterdam before, and this hotel was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly32678
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and got a great deal. The hotel is in a good location and is very clean and nicely decorated. Our room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and they offer free wi-fi in their lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Isabel F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, quite and the location was excellent! Just across the street and canal was the main bar and restaurant area. Tram 1 stopped right in front of the hotel which was great going to and from Central Station, which is how we arrived and left Amsterdam. The hotel looks like it would use another remodel. The carpets were getting old, mainly in the hallways especially by the elevator and the furniture in the rooms was getting chipped from people bumping into it. Other then that I was more concerned with a clean, safe room and thats what we got. I would recommend staying here, but the price was a bit high for what we got. But than again, all the hotels in Amsterdam were priced very high compared to other locations we visited on our trip. So this was a good middle ground.

Reviews.Title: “Verry late check in”
Reviews.Author: brown812005
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for one night 16-17 september 2011 they checked me in at 03:00 pm and they where trying to sell me a 40 euros extra room. Besides that is a decent hotel... Clean rooms are a bit small.....

Reviews.Title: “Good location and functional rooms”
Reviews.Author: magic_maggie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and the rooms quite OK. The standard rooms are not very big but they are clean and functional. Cost is a bit high though but it's probably due to its location. We went for a Congress and booked 50 rooms there. It was not easy to get answers from the NH staff before our arrival. The invoice sent afterwards didn't match what we had used or asked for.... I would not advise it for group bookings, but for individuals coming to discover the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the money. Look elsewhere for better deals.”
Reviews.Author: Rothko9
Reviews.Content: NH Amsterdam Centre. The star system of judging standards for hotels should definitely be revised unless it is lose all credibility especially about this hotel. With Asia raising the standards all the time 4 stars for the NH Amsterdam Centre is definitely wishful thinking on the owners part and for the money represents very poor value. The location cannot be faulted but this is the only thing I can recommend about it, being close to the Museum Quarter (about 5 minutesâ€™ walk distant). Having stayed in a few Travel Lodges over the past few years I believe their standards excel those of NH Amsterdam Centre, with free TV and the tea and coffee facility being replenished. Not so for the NH Amsterdam Centre. The view from the window overlooked other hotel rooms and air conditioning units. The rooms were clean but not up to standard, with the floor being uneven causing stubbed toes on occasion. The worst problem was the sound of moving furniture all night which the staff tried to blame on the air conditioning! I loved Amsterdam but will need a lot of persuading that things have improved before considering returning to the NH Amsterdam Centre, which should be re-graded to 2 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeChemist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of three large hotels on the corner of the Leidesplein in Amsterdam - a location that I strongly recommend to new visitors because of the large number of restaurants and activities at that site. The property is not quite up to the level of the nearby Marriott or American Hotels but it is well maintained. The rooms are relatively large by European standards (I would recommend that you ask to be upgraded to the largest available - you won't be disappointed.) The furnishings are very nice. The staff is very well trained. For the price, it might be the best hotel available on the Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and clean too!”
Reviews.Author: gardengirl102
Reviews.Content: Perhaps we were lucky, but our room was not cramped at all - they were nice rooms with fairly large bathrooms. The bed was comfy and it was very clean. I wonder if they have upgraded some rooms because we booked 3 rooms and we were all very pleased with what we got. Like many others we booked several months ahead through priceline and got an excellent rate. Check in was slow but I think that was the fault of a lady that stepped to the front of the line and then spent 10 -15 minutes taking up the time of one receptionist, while 3 families were trying to check in. I would definitely stay here again. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonyangary
Reviews.Content: The one good thing about this hotel is its location, however, we suggest you go elsewhere. (1) When we were checking in, in the lobby, there were two somewhat older woman sitting and waiting. A guy, dressed sort of like the hotel people came by and said "I'll take your bags" and he grabbed their luggage and took off. The lady lost her money and passport. The hotel staff wasn't very helpful to them and they had no security cameras pointed at that location in the lobby. (2) They have a "secure" carded elevator. Oh, but the stairs next to it go up to unlocked hall doors so that anyone can get up to any floor. (3) The room was OK if you don't mind stained carpet. (4) They have one computer for printing out flight tickets in the lobby. This computer is occupied and so unavailable usually be a befuddled person who can't get to their website for hours. (5) WORST OF ALL: After we checked out and got home, they stuck additional charges on our credit card: $43 for the mini-bar. We never use the mini-bar, in fact it was almost empby -- a stocking error on their part for which they charged us and simply refuse to take off (as if, a middle aged couple would write them emails, call them in a desparate effort to avoid paying for some Pepsis). It's a sloppy, ill-managed, unprofessional and insecure place. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Location was the best!”
Reviews.Author: Marlen714
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at NH Amsterdam Centre having picked it for it's great location. We got that and then some. The hotel itself is very nice with a functional lobby, pleasant front desk staff, restaurants and bar. The room was wonderful - clean, comfortable, pleasant, large bathroom and bedroom. The free wifi was only available in the lobby with a 30 minute code but that was ok. The best of the hotel was it's location. Steps away from Leidse Square, Vondelpark, Heineken Brewery and the museums. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value convenient location”
Reviews.Author: chorltongary
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel which I had booked through priceline at a very good rate. The rooms were clean (as you would expect) and the bathrooms excellent with walk in power showers. The beds were comfortable and despite its location on a busy road, I found the rooms to be quiet at night. The location of the hotel is excellent being just off the leidseplein and very close to the museum area. It isnt too far to walk to Dam square but there is a tram stop right outside the hotel if you are feeling lazy. The lifts in the hotel were very efficient. I never had to wait any time for a lift going up or down during our 4 night stay. I cant comment on the breakfast because the priceline deal didnt include breakfast and I didnt fancy paying the 19 euros they wanted for the breakfast buffet (Why do hotels charge so much for breakfast and for minibars ?). There are plenty of places near by where you can get a breakfast in the sunshine and watch the world go by. The tv in the room was a bit old fashioned and there was a very limited number of english channels but that is a minor gripe as I didnt go to Amsterdam to watch telly !

Reviews.Title: “Definite winner”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaIsabella
Reviews.Content: Wow, modern hip hotel except for box style tv. 4euro airport bus. Purchased hotel on Priceline for $95 US. My room was small and was upgraded for an extra $40 euro.. Basically I got a very large superior room for about $160. Beautiful wood floors. I was shown 2 superior rooms. The room on the even number was smaller than the odd. Choose any of the 27's 227.327,427 etc... Free wifi in the lobby. It expires after 30 minutes but enter in a new code and you will be fine. There is also a computer for use. The paid Internet is approx. 8euros. Funky bar, lobby area. Directly across street from American touristy restaurants, bars and coffeeshop , appropriately called Rookies. H&M , Hard Rock,Burger King, and most importantly Starbucks Free wifi in Starbucks,Burger King, Rookies and in almost every other establishment. Exit hotel and walk to the right and will run into Heineken factory. Exit hotel walk straight across street across canal, walk up straight on same street as Starbucks and McDonalds,when you get to the 2nd canal make a left and after a15 minute walk, you'll run into the Anne Frank house behind the large church ( on right hand side of canal). It costs 8.50. The alley where the line is, is extremely cold and the line is about 2 hours wait. Exit hotel and directly across street on canal there are canal and bike rentals. Bikes cost $12 euros. If you walk straight across street outside of hotel (past Starbucks, McDonalds) and keep walking about 20 minutes without turning , you will reach a better shopping area. On the right side of street are Diesel, Mac etc... Once you see Mac, the next street turn left and it's a very very major shopping area. Smaller street with no cars full of clothing and shoe shops. Keep walking and at the end of that street is a large square. Cross over square and you will find the cheap souvenir places.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenlass1903
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days with my other half and teenage child. We were given a room with 2 single beds but after a trip to reception we were given a kingsize room and they added a single bed within 10 mins. Very attentative. I stayed at the Marriot next door last year and Id say the NH is the better hotel at this location. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at the right price does the trick”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticCanadian
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a great price on Priceline, the hotel was adequate for our needs. I think we must have been given an upgraded room because it was not tiny as indicated in other reviews - it certainly wasn't as small as my Paris hotel. Also had a large bath instead of a shower. Rooms are pretty quiet as we were close to the elevator but didn't hear much from neighbours or others in the hallway - not even a door slam. The room overlooked the back so no street noise either although there wasn't much of a view into another building. Hotel was steps to airport bus on the bridge across the street. Much cheaper at 4 euros than the 37 euros taxi advertized by the hotel. And frankly, just as convenient. It takes about 40 minutes to Schiphol. Bike rental is available at the hotel for 15 euros but we found cheaper bike shop 5 minutes away down Overtoom for 11 euros daily. Biking is by far the easiest way to get around in Amsterdam especially now that they have gotten rid of strippen bus tickets and it costs 2.6 euros per trip! Went to the restaurant alleys near Leidesplein one night for dinner and that was enough. Convenient but so very touristy and crowded so of course food was mediocre. Instead try De Koe (The Cow) on nearby Marnixstraat 381 - a local pub-like restaurant frequented by locales. I think we were the only tourists there and the waitress kindly translated the blackboard menu for us. Yummy Osso bucco and Seafood fettucine with a beer and soda for 30 euros. Finally - free wifi in the lobby is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belinda1203
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July, The position is not a bad one, a easy walk to Musuems, canal boats and resturants even though we would of preferred to be closer to the Center, there is a very handy tram stop right across the road. The check in was fast the staff friendly and helpfull. at first impression the hotel seemed a bit dark and danky, the carpeting in the hall ways were some of the dirtiest Ive seen, but thankfully the rooms had timber floors were a good size and had a nice view over a garden,and appeared quite clean and were cleaned well daily. I did try room service and the food was not great. I got a good price on PL for the room, so the hotel was well worth the money and overall a good hotel.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Tight room but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: traveler_ap
Reviews.Content: The title says it all... We travel to Europe often but were struck by how small our room was. Very tight with 2 people and our luggage. And not inexpensive by any means! (This proves correct what I had heard about finding rooms in Amsterdam...they book up quickly and are pricey.) The room and bathroom were clean. For my first time in Amsterdam the location worked well; convenient for walking to sights as well as catching trams/buses. FYI the bus to Keukenhopf (?) was very close, 5 minute walk. The breakfast spread was great! Too bad I slept through it the first morning. The front desk staff seemed quite competent (except when there was no one at the front desk which I experienced a few times).

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: givanildobs
Reviews.Content: Staffs very kind, amazing hotel, very well located near bus stop and station train. Good breakfast (paid), view to the river channel. Rooms clean...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCNIreland
Reviews.Content: Our room was very good with a clean, modern bathroom. Although the hotel is not exactly dead in the centre of the city, it is within walking distance of all of the main attractions. There are about one hundred restaurants lining the streets near the hotel and there are many attractions within a stone's throw. the breakfast was very good and the hotel staff were very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: nothometoday
Reviews.Content: Our cruise line booked this stay for us, and we're glad they did. Staff at the front desk were all very helpful, and were able to get into our room when we arrived at 11 AM. Our first room assignment was a disappointment, but that was due to our misunderstanding of their use of "double" and "twin". When we said we'd take a double, we were assigned a very small room with a double (not queen) bed. When we immediately asked to be switched to a twin, we were accommodated igraciously. The room felt clean and crisp--wood laminate floors instead of carpet, sleek furnishings and sparkling bathroom fixtures. We enjoyed 2 nights of good sleep on our very comfortable mattresses (a "twin" is a king size bed with 2 separate mattresses.) Breakfast was adequate--just avoid the steam table eggs--everything else is fine, and served in a lovely dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: emthebabe
Reviews.Content: Hotel comfortable and very welcoming for children. Location great, trams from central station really easy to use! We had to travel with my young son (aged 18 months) and found Amsterdam hotels as a whole very unwelcoming with most if the top rated Trip Advisor hotels not allowing under 16's. NH hotels however do and we were extremely impressed with their assistance - my son even received his own children's toiletries in a lovely bag!! The only criticisms I would have are the usual - bar drinks very expensive although that is really the same i guess at any city centre hotel. The facilities for food at the hotel were limited and due to travelling with a young child on our arrival day we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. It has won several awards but in our experience it wasn't so great. Advertised as opening at 6 we booked a table to be told to arrive at 630 and were then kept waiting for over an hour for our food. Initially we were the only people in the restaurant but by the time our food arrived it was getting quite busy but my son was also quite agitated by this point and began i feel upsetting some of the other diners. Had the service been better we would have eaten and been our before he became bored and also before the other guests arrived! Food was average and very expensive and to top it off we found three hairs that were baked into the bread that was served! Not great for a supposed gourmet restaurant! On the positive side rooms were clean and comfortable, mini bar was not over priced, location was great and staff very helpful. Locally there were a multitude of places to eat and drink and the atmosphere was amazing! Would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, some great, some good, some so so”
Reviews.Author: Whizzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights at the NH Amsterdam Center in Leidensplein, which is near the museum section of Amsterdam. The hotel was recommended for us by the cruise line, but overall ended up being a good stay. In reference to the title, the location was fabulous for walking to all of our desired things to see, including museums, Dam Square, Ann Frank huis and red light district, central shopping areas in the old town, etc. Also just down the street from the hotel is an entrance into beautiful Vondel Park. We had two different rooms (one being prior to our cruise, and one after.) The first room on the second floor was very small, two people and luggage filled up the space fast and left little room. Basically being the size of two small beds - but with a small balcony and french door that was very pleasant to leave open to watch the endlessly fascinating herds of bicycles go by on the street below. The other room we had on the first floor was bigger, with room for a couch - but no balcony. The bathroom in the first room had a stall shower (quite roomy) and was very clean. The bathroom in the second room was a tub/shower that was also roomy and clean - but with a very high rise to get in and out of same making the wet exit somewhat precarious. One complaint is that you get a tiny chip of orange (but pleasantly scented) soap - and that the shampoo and body wash seem to be exactly the same product. The beds were comfortable in both rooms. There was only 1 pillow per bed in the room, but the room service menu lists pillow options, which we did not bother with. The TV was difficult to use in the second room, but we were in the room such a short period of time that we did not miss using the TV. Our room included breakfast in the restaurant off the lobby, Attractively decorated in a modern style, this restaurant has windows overlooking the back of the building out to a street - a nice view. The restaurant was very busy every morning and bustling - somtimes the cheese and pastry trays cleared out, but were generally refilled without too much delay. The food choices in the buffet are nice and varied - our favorites included the gouda cheese/leiden cheese, wide variety of delicious danish pastries, fresh fruits and cereal/yogurt options. There are also hot trays with eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes, baked tomatoes. We liked all the hot items except the eggs, which had a strange taste to us like reconstituted powder, so we did not eat them. We noticed on a walking tour of the city that there are a variety of NH hotels in Amsterdam - some looked more upscale than ours, but cannot advise on those.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: amihaic
Reviews.Content: Very nice looking hotel, the lobby is fun to sit in and watch the people go by in the street through the giant window. There's free wireless and internet access in the lobby, but it's limited to 15/30 minutes using login IDs, which is sometimes annoying. The rooms are comfortable and look very good. The huge shower is amazing! Oh, and the location. About 200 steps from Leidseplien. It's both close and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We got ripped off”
Reviews.Author: fcharmain
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the NH Amsterdam Centre Hotel when we concluded our river cruise with Uniworld. Up until that time, the trip was very good. This was a post cruise 2 day stay in Amsterdam, and from the minute we arrived it was very disappointing. We arrived at the hotel in the morning, and to their credit they did have our room ready. We had requested a room with two twin beds as my husband has a breathing machine at night so we need two beds. We went into the room and there was a 1 double bed. On top of that the carpet in the room was stained, and the room was quite small considering we paid 1258.00 Cdn for 2 nights thru Uniworld, as they did the reservation. That works out to 629.00 Cdn for each night, and for that kind of money we expected a much bigger room that was without stained carpets. We did go and talk to the front desk and they were very accomodating as they found us another room with twin beds. We decided to upgrade to a jr. suite for an extra 120 euros a night, and it was worth it as the room was much bigger, but it also had stained carpets, as well as a stain on the couch. We had breakfast the next morning in their dining room. The food when it was available was good, although they had a tough time keeping up with the food as they were a bit shy of staff. The staff they did have were being run off their feet trying to keep up with the coffee and juice as well as replenish the buffet trays. The restaurant wasn't open after they served breakfast, as we were told we had to eat in the lounge in the lobby. The menu items were very poor as you had a very limited choice on the menu. It was a one page menu with very little to choose from. The Italian restaurant wasn't open on Sundays, so we chose to go there on our last night in Amsterdam which was a Monday and for some reason it was still closed. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. My beef is the way the hotel is run. They are very understaffed and the staff they do have are extremely accomodating, especially the girls who work at the reception desk. When we called for someone to come and get our bags the day we left, the girl from the reception desk showed up. She did her best to heave our heavy bags onto the cart, but it was not her job. Where are the porters, does this hotel not have any??? Shameful For the life on me I cannot understand why we paid so much for a basic double room with no extra amenities, when i look at their website, it looks like I can get the same kind of room at the same hotel for about 400.00 less per night. Someone is making a lot of money on these post cruises at our expense. From now on I will make our own reservations for post cruises so I know exactly what I'm getting. This was a 2 star hotel at the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Another not so good experience with NH!”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time in NH chain and I will take care never to visit any of their hotels again. They are too basic and poor for their prices. Room is small and smelly. You have to pay extra for everything: internet, fitness, breakfast... The whole experience is not very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location on the Outside-Poor Overpriced Facility Inside”
Reviews.Author: wasahoosier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into the NH as part of a Rhine River cruise pre-stay. We were there 2 nights and 3 days. The hotel location was very convenient for walking and boarding local transportation. The reception and bar staff was very good. The pictures posted by NH on the Trip Advisor website were accurate, but not totally representative of all of their rooms. Our room was quite small. It was on the first floor which had filthy hallway carpet. There was room for 1 suitcase stand and we had to use the business work table for everything else. The bathroom tub/shower was a safety nightmare. The one grab handle was difficult to reach because of the way it was mounted; a second grab handle would have been welcome, and, the bottom of the tub was very, very slick. The vanity must have been designed for a giant, the lavatory pop-up didnâ€™t contain water as it should, and the mirror had been damaged resulting in blurred vision. We ate at the included breakfast buffet 4 mornings. The first morning was the worst. There wasnâ€™t any table service out on cleared tables and the rest either had patrons or hadnâ€™t been bussed. No servers were visible. There were no water or juice glasses. The hot food needed replenished. The coffee dispenser had run out of coffee and here wasnâ€™t any milk for the dry cereal. The Food & Beverage Manager answer to these problems was that she had no way of knowing when a large group would go through the buffet; and that they prevented her staff from filling-in the empty containers. This sounded like a management problem to me-not patrons. Anyway, days 2, 3, and 4 showed some improvement; however, the water/juice glass absence continued, and we never found cereal and milk available at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel easily accessible from Centraal train station by tram”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers4
Reviews.Content: We booked the NH Amsterdam hotel on Priceline and paid $124 USD including tax ($99 before tax). The staff was friendly and helpful; the room was very clean and comfortable. We felt very safe in and around the area; in fact, you must use your room key to access the elevator. Directions on the hotel website to get there from Centraal train station were vague. If you do arrive from Centraal: Follow the tram signs out of the train station. Get on any of the 1,2 or 5 trams. You pay an attendant on the tram, who can make change for you. You can only enter through the front and rear doors for that reason. Exit at Leidse Square stop (about the 5th one). Turn left and walk southeast on Leidseplain Street past Cafe Americain and over the canal bridge; the hotel will be visible across your street and to your right. When we checked in, we were given a room on the first floor. Based on other travelers' recommendations, due to noise on the first several floors, we asked if it was possible to be moved to a higher floor. They were very accommodating and placed us on the 7th floor. Noise was not a problem at all. If you need to print boarding passes or otherwise need to use a computer, ask the front desk for a voucher(s). We made the mistake of needlessly paying 8,95 Euro for 24 hours for the hotel wi-fi service when all we needed to do was to print our boarding passes. And, it appears that there is free wi-fi in the lobby, anyway - just not in your room. The view out our window was OK (Burger King sign) but not great. There was no soap (hand or bath) provided, so bring your own! A blow dryer is provided. The electricity in the room (except for outlets to charge your phone, etc) will not operate unless you place your room key in a slot inside the door. Maybe this is common in Europe, but we thought it was very innovative...saves energy in case you forget to turn off the lights when you leave the room, and you always know where your room key is! The bathtub edge is very high (not sure if we've ever seen one as high), so you need to be careful entering and exiting; would not be suitable for guests with mobility difficulties. Upon checkout, we were told that we needed to pay tax on the room, as we had booked on Priceline and it was not included. Thankfully, I had the printout of our booking and was able to show her that we had, indeed, paid tax. She checked with her manager and said we were OK (but you wonder how many Priceline guests have paid double tax!) Overall, good value for the money we paid and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at NH Amsterdam Centre, which has a fantastic location next to Leidseplein, which means Leidse Square. The room was decent-sized, clean, modern, and elegant. It was also very quiet, though the hotel overlooks a major street. The hotel's location is very convenient for exploring the city. There are many restaurants nearby. Also, a canal cruise company line has a stop diagonally across the street from the hotel. The area around the hotel appeared safe late at night as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location from which to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adjacent to the Leidseplein, which is an excellent part of the city from which to explore theatre and museum districts as well as the upscale shopping area. The location is relatively quiet and the sound insulation of the hotel effectively screens out city noise. This is a very modern hotel, with an inviting, elegantly furnished lobby and bar. We were given a comfortable room with a balcony where I sat drinking morning tea and watching cats climb along the roofs of the canal houses across the way. The room also had a sofa and comfortable chair, as well as two cozy twin beds. Satellite television, pay movies, individual climate control, and a well stocked mini bar made it an elegant, comfortable refuge after a long day of sight-seeing. Shuttle bus to Schiphol is quick and reasonably priced. Only downside: internet isn't free, except in the lobby using vouchers from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced & Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: veggienb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, extremely expensive but it seems all of Amsterdam is. Anyhow, here are the pros and cons of my stay: Pros: - Clean Room - Excellent location - Quiet bedroom Cons: - Reception is painfully slow - Checkout on Sunday's are supposed to be 5pm but we were unable to checkout at 5pm as advertised as they were fully booked. If they cannot commit to their advertisements, then don't advertise it as an added value! - Small bedroom - Small bathroom - No free WiFi I would not stay here again nor recommend it unless it was half the price I paid. Overpriced when you consider what you get which is a small quiet bedroom and no added value.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOPEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for one night. The standard web price was very high (E265). My company was hosting a meeting, so the rate was more reasonable but, even that seemed high as my room was very basic. Breakfast, which was good, was not included in the price nor was the internet in the hotel room. Their conferencing facilities were also basic...microphones which didn't work, and a small projector screen which was difficult to see from the back of the room. At lunch, the plates were dirty. The waitress must have gone through at least 15 in the stack before she could find one clean enough to give me. I expect more from a 4 star hotel charging these prices.

Reviews.Title: “WE enjoyed our stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: minimini
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with 2 young kids. We got 2 nights at a good rate on Priceline but the other 2 ( weekend) we had to pay rack rates...and it was not cheap... around 200 euros. We got a big room, with 2 queen beds. The room was very confortable and quiet ( it faced the courtyard/ air conditioners roof...so, no view at all). We just had an issue with the housekeeping the first day - they did not clean our room up to 5 pm. Internet was about 10 euros a day in the room, but free in the lobby for 30 min. Breakfast was ok, but have had better in other NH hotels.

Reviews.Title: “In terms of what it cost the worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: oharae
Reviews.Content: Great location but that's about it. I paid 228 euros for a Friday night. The room was tiny - a shoe box and stank of drains. I complained and a serviceman came and said that the cleaner had replaced the shower waste trap in the wrong way - no apology. The smell did clear after a few hours. At breakfast there was an infestation of bugs and ants at my table. The food was the usual drab NH breakfast fayre. Terrible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s OK but not good enough for a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yugobetrugo
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The beds are good as well which is quite rare for hotels in my opinion. The rooms look modern and I like the design of the hotel in general. But besides that I was not very happy at all. Every thing costs extra and it is kinda a rip off. Not that I care much about the money but you donÂ´t feel well when they are trying to get every cent from you. Wireless Lan costs extra and its really expansive. You get a neat control so you can watch movies , porn and surf through the internet via Television which also costs a fortune. Ok the mineybar prices are expansive in every hotel thats acceptable but what think is really bad is that there is a fitness center but it costs like 15 euro per day(correct me if I am wrong ) and it was just open for couple of hours. Also when they find drugs in your hotel, they dont call the police but they charge you with 50 Euro(again could be 75 but sure anymore) for "cleaning money". Not that I have been catched but its the first thing they say. In such an atmosphere I dont feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but misleading advertisements.”
Reviews.Author: BellaChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Great little place just outside of Leidensplein (sp?) area. Close to bars, "coffee shops", metro, restaurants, casino, everything you could need. We had a view of the courtyard, which was decent, but not great. Wifi is advertised as free, but in actuality, it is only free in the lobby and you must ask for a pass which comes in only 30 min increments. A little annoying. Advert in the lobby states room upgrade, breakfast and late checkout package starting at 15 Euro. TOTALLY misleading, and a down right lie. In actuality, 15 Euro gets you VIP treatment, and it shoots up to 80+ Euro for any of the advertised "upgrades". Why would I pay you 15 Euro to be extra nice to me? Very misleading, and you feel cheap when you ask about it and find out it's actually REALLY expensive for late check out, breakfast, or room upgrade. Located very close to everything. Easily accesable from the Amsterdam Centraal Station (only about 5 stops). Be careful to make sure you go to the proper nH hotel, as we made the mistake of going to a similarly named nH City Center rather than nH Center when we arrived. We saw another traveler do the exact same thing. For a cheap meal, Italian places in the nearby square will offer pasta, pizza, and other entrees for only 5 Euro. VERY close walking distance, and very easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, central chain hotel on the right side of town”
Reviews.Author: C_Bridge85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend. It cost around Â£140 a night which is more than we wanted to pay, however if we had booked in advance or got an online deal I'm sure we could have got a much better rate. However, we did not want to take any chances and I knew NH had good hotels from previous stays elsewhere in Europe. This hotel did not disappoint. I thought the staff were excellent and very helpful. The location was great too. I would definately recommend staying in the Museum quarter away from the roudiness of the red light district, as its still very central for nightlife and such a short walk to all the major museums. I guess the only thing I could possibly fault is of course as an international chain it did not feel particularly 'Dutch'. But I'm sure boutique hotels at the weekend would have astronomical prices so I'm happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Awesome Staff Tops It Off”
Reviews.Author: RRWorld
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel is at a great location, across the street from Leidesplein, close to everything! A short bus ride away from the airport. Very easy to get to. Hats off to all the wonderful staff at the hotel. Every staff person we met there was so friendly and helpful. Very patient. Free internet credit? No problem. Needed help with printing because the lobby printer doesn't work? No problem. Late check-out? No problem. I give them 10* for outstanding services!! Rooms are also nice. We heard the rooms facing the streets could be noisy, so we requested for a high-floor room facing the back and we didn't hear a thing at night. The bathroom/toilet area could be a bit tight, as other reviewers have pointed out, but it wasn't too big of a problem for us (my husband is 6'2"). We won our bid on priceline for this stay, so definitely great value for us. But priceline or not, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: salsaaudi
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends and we stayed at this hotel recently for 3 nights. This hotel has a great location and within walking distance to Leidseplein. Laidseplein have lots and lots of pubs and restaurants and is a great spot for party. The Vondelpark is just meters away if you want a relaxed stroll or for a energetic run:) The hotelstaff is friendly and smiling and were willing to help with out ever assistence we needed! Our rooms are resonably sized, quite, and very tidy with fresh towels every day. The breakfast costs you â‚¬19 but is really good with lots of varm and cold food/drink. Try it at least for one day! I can defintely reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Tip top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabeltann
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 9 friends with the only purpose of relaxing and fun. The hotel is located in just the rigth walkingdistance (3 min) from Leidseplein which is one of the best party places in Amsterdam. Friendly and helpfull staff. Clean nice rooms with a good bed, and a good breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, brilliant location in the centre of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Dee1989
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam with my partner. I was very happy with the location of the hotel, just down from Liedesplein and around the corner from Vondelpark. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Checking in was easy, the staff were very friendly. We had a room on the front of the hotel. We couldn't hear any traffic or noise from the main road in front of the hotel. The rooms were cleaned everyday and the towels were changed daily. The bathroom was bright and spacious. We found that all the main attractions were within walking distance, so we walked everywhere around Amsterdam. However, the trams were efficient and frequent directly in front of our hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay in this hotel when we return to Amsterdam in the future. We booked via Priceline but obviously throught this website you cannot choose this hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sylvana123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on lastminute.com as a secret hotel and to be honest, I was disappointed when I found it was this hotel as I had been convinced it was another of the NH group. However, couldn't change it as I'd already paid. There were 3 couples in our group and we all thought the hotel was great. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms were very clean and spacious. The bathroom was bright and spacious with a great shower and vanity area. The hairdryer was better than any other hotel hairdryer I had previously used. Checking in and out was faultless with helpful & pleasant staff. The hotel is very near the Riksmuseum, Vondelpark and Leidseplein although it is a 5-6 minute tram ride from the Red Light district and Central Station. We walked to Anne Frank's House which we are glad we did because it was definitely worth seeing. It is a lovely 10 minute walk from the hotel. (Tip: If possible, book your tickets online to avoid the queues. We arrived at 10.30am Monday and waited 40 minutes!) The only downside was the number of trams we took at â‚¬2.60 per trip. Had we known we would have bought a 24/48/72 hour tram pass at Central Station which is â‚¬13 for 72 hours. We would definitely stay in this hotel again on a future trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuftyklub
Reviews.Content: While not right in the centre of Amsterdam, the hotel is in a good location, very easy to get to by tram from Central Station and a few minutes walk from Vondelpark (definitely worth a visit). I thought the design was very nice and we did have a fairly good sized bathroom - but there is definitely variation between rooms of the same price. We travelled with friends and the twin room was a good size, but another couple in a double room only had a shower whereas we had a bath with shower. The beds were very comfortable and we both slept very well. Also the staff were lovely and check in / out was very easy. A couple of other reviews mentioned some issues with noise - we were in a room right on the main road and didn't have any problems. If anything, the main problem was noise from people in the hall (plus people weirdly trying to get into our room a couple of times over the weekend!). I would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you can get a good deal on Expedia. The only downside was having to pay to use the Fitness Centre which I would expect to be included in the price of a 4 start hotel (so we didn't use it funnily enough). The House of Bols is about 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel and definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the first floor”
Reviews.Author: Kewstokie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times now. I cannot fault the location, staff, cleanliness and facilities, though to be fair the carpets and decorating in the corridors is now showing age. It is a short walk to Leidseplein and has convenient tram stops (pick up a travel pass at the Tourist Bureau in Schiphol or at Amsterdam Centraal station) External noise can be an issue in the front, particularly on the 1st and 2nd floors. The back is quiter but has no view. On previous stays I have been on the 2nd or 4th floors, and had no noise issues at night. Unfortunately I had the misfortune this time to be given a room on the 1st floor. This seems to be the floor where they put school parties. If screaming kids banging doors at night is your scene then fine. Otherwise ask if there are alternative rooms or check the location of school parties before you sign in! I'll stay here again no doubt, but be a little more aware.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: RWH555
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay here! The hotel is absoulutely fablous. My wife and I enjoyed very much. It has large rooms, well we stay in a suite as we were upgraded, but rooms were great. Wife even got a massage...The square (Liedsplien)? is 5 min walk about where all the happening stuff is. We took the tram to the red light dist. which took about 10 minutes and the tram back to Central Station to catch the Thyls back to Paris...very easy...if you like to be close to everything, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: tourister123
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights recently. Agree with all of the positive comments. One huge negative; the woefully narrow toilet wedged between a solid shower stall wall and the solid wall of the vanity. I stand 186cm and not overweight and I had difficulty using the toilet; imagine this- sitting with your thighs fused together. The stall for the toilet was narrower than a flight seat in economy! LOL. Never noticed it until much later in my stay and didn't want to pack everything up to change rooms. This alone could destroy an otherwise perfect stay, so be forewarned. So if you get a room here, tell the front-desk clerk you "don't want one of those rooms with a narrow toilet". When you get to the room, inspect the bathroom immediately; if you see no bathtub but a nice (wide) walk-in shower stall instead, put the toilet seat cover down and see if you fit! If not, then call the front desk and ask for another room with a normal toilet. Other than that, you can't do much better than this hotel for location and the up-to-date, clean and comfortable rooms. They could update the TVs from the old box type to the newer large flat-screens monitors. I've stayed at the Marriot next door and prefer their rooms for comfort (better beds, showers and yes- toilets). Being on the Leidesplein gives you really convenient options for eating (everything from Burger-King open til 3am, Macdonalds, or lots of great restaurants in every price range), Walk to Museums, flower market, etc. 1 tram to Central Station and Public transit to and from Schipol airport (4 Euros). Friendly Front Desk people know all this info so just ask them.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, pokey room, poor service, too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: BOD2
Reviews.Content: Good location and fab breakfast. However, room service dishes not removed for 48 hours, limescale on taps and shower head, dirty carpets, dowdy/gloomy atmosphere, tiny double room (more like a small single), misinformed on cost of hotel approved taxi (cost and extra 11 euros) and dirty carpets. Plus get a mortgage if you have anything out of the minibar!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Amsterdam hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the NH Amsterdam Centre on business trips 3 times, and twice have had very large rooms with a sofa for watching TV; one time it was a much smaller room with no couch. I love the clean, modern feel of this hotel - dark wood floors, simple furnishings, lovely modern bathroom. The bed is comfortable and they offer a choice of different pillows on request. The breakfast is also above average with a nice assortment of hot and cold dishes. A key card is necessary for the elevators, which adds to the feeling of security. I think it is much nicer than the Marriott next door. Front desk service is adequate. One time, we had difficulty with them charging different rates for three of us all on the same corporate rate, although we eventually got it sorted out. This trip, I asked when checking in whether this rate included breakfast, and was told yes. Checking out the next morning, they tried to charge me for it, and when I raised the issue, they advised me the rate did not include breakfast but as I'd been misinformed, they waived the charge. The location is convenient for travel by car, and an easy walk to most tourist sites. However, for leisure travel I prefer being closer to Centraal train station, which makes it so easy to travel to/from the airport; it would be a bit of a hike to walk to the NH from the train station with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, for sightseeing and Transport”
Reviews.Author: Holden33
Reviews.Content: Would recommend the Hotel. Although the room that we stayed in was overlooking the Road and we could hear the traffic and people outside all night long.Would suggest if you are a light sleeper to request a room at the back of the Hotel Transport from the airport was excellent.. Right at the front of the airport look for Bus Stand B11. You want the 197 Bus[ they run every 15 mins] which stops right across from the Hotel. The stop you request is 'Leidersplein' . It was 4 Euros per person each way which is excellent value compared to a taxi [ 40 euros]. You know you are there with the illuminated sign inside the bus which tells you which bus stop you are at. It takes about 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; clean; safe; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AnneinVirginia
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel with Priceline for $75 USD a night including taxes & fees. No complants. Clean, great location, very roomy and view. The elevator required your room key so you had a feeling of safety. Nice Bathroom. Arrived by train and took tram to hotel. There is a tram line that stops in front of the hotel and several lines that stop just across the canal. Casino and Hard Rock Cafe across the canal & many good restauants on the street behind the hotel. I could walk to most museums and the Concertgebouw but also used the tram which was quick and easy. Amsterdam was very friendly & tram drivers are very helpful. You can pay on board and ask for information. Also, ask for free internet passes at the front desk. They gave me all I needed but you must us in the lobby. There is also a lobby PC & Printer - also free with passes from front desk. I took a laptop but used the lobby PC so I could print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and contempo rooms”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave us great directions via bus from the airport and we quickly found the property. It was close to everything we wanted to see... walking distance to Anne Frank Huis, Van Gogh museum, city center and many restaurants. We were there right after Christmas and temps were very cold but we only took the tram once because everything was so walkable. The room was very contemporary with wood-like floors and modern decor. The bed was a little worn but it was manageable. After traveling through Europe with only CNN and BBC as the only available English channels, the variety of English channels and American shows on the hotel's cable was quite welcome. Only 2 complaints on the room... one was that we left the Do Not Disturb sign up on the first day as we did not want the room made up and we came back to a made up room. This has never happened to me before where the maid has disregarded the sign. The second was the street noise - we were on the second floor facing the canal (which I think the hotel regards as a view) and there was street noise most day and night, including the ring ring of the tram. I wasn't woken up but it was a little noisy. Overall we were satisfied with the hotel and location. Got a great deal through Priceline.
