Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: tjb42
Reviews.Content: The location it the real draw here. The local bus to and from the airport stops almost directly across the street and runs quite frequently. It's next door to the Marriott, so you know it's a great location. Leidsplein is a great square, the Hard Rock Cafe and Casino are across the street, the Heineken Experience is 10 minutes walk away and Museumsplein is a 5 minute walk away. The outer ring canal of the city center is directly across the street. The lobby is modern and quite lovely. The rooms are small, but not smaller than most European hotels. The rooms was well furnished to a high standard, very comfortable bed. You may want to ask for a room facing out though as our view was to another part of the building directly across and we looked down on to the roof and the HVAC system. The bathroom was clean and quite nice, a great tub. We got a special rate and found it to be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Heather9678
Reviews.Content: we absolutely loved this location, close to everything, the tram was across the street and the museums were close enough to walk to. The rooms were clean and roomy for Europe. Hated the fact that I had to be in the lobby to use the WIFI but that was the only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelaround
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on Priceline for an really, unbelievable low price. I would not have been able to get a 3 star for the money. I really thought the hotel was great. I was given a large room at the front of the hotel on the 6th floor. I did not notice any issue with noise and I slept great on a large, comfortable bed with great black out drapes. The view over the canal to the Leidseplein was great. The bathroom was large and a 2 head shower and the room was very clean. I have been to Amsterdam many times, so I did not need much help from the staff, but they were friendly and helpful when I needed anything. I really do not understand some of the complaints in these reviews. If you have to wait a few minutes while they help someone else, what is the big deal? Anyway, I had no issues at all. I would have thought this was a great hotel even if I had paid much closer to the typical web site rates. Based on my Priceline rate, it was a steal. I did not have breakfast, so can not comment on that. You are a short walk from a grocery store and literally dozens of bars, restaurants and shops. Very close to trams to get anywhere you want as well. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: petraleon
Reviews.Content: Poor value hotel. Advantages: Very good location (walking distance to several attractions and nightlife, very close to tramlines and river cruises), spotlessly clean, quiet rooms at the back side of the hotel. Disadavantages: Pricey, very noisy rooms at the front side of the hotel (don't even try it except if you can book a superior room at a high floor), dull rooms at the back side of the hotel with a view to offices and storage rooms but quiet and more spacious than those at the front, inadequate and understaffed reception (you have to wait 5 to 10 minutes every time you want to speak with someone and there's nobody to give directions or advice to tourists - Only 2 persons from 5 were kind and helpful), no free wi-fi and even worse, just one computer at the reception room which you have to pay to check your e-mails when it works. Overall, decent stay but very cold and unwelcome hotel. Next time I would try to find a hotel around the 9 streets district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: korovak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in November 2010. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room we got was pretty big with the view to the Leidseplein square. However the room furniture had some visible scratches. The hotel has a great central location. 10-20 minutes walk from all major attractions in Amsterdam. There is a tram stop in front of the hotel. There is a 197 bus stop at the bridge in front of the hotel. We took this bus to get to the hotel for 4 euro (30 minutes ride).The WiFi internet is free only in the lobby (with 30 minutes vaucher that must be taken from reception) and there is only one desktop computer. We won this hotel at priceline for $92 per night (including tax) so it's definitely worth this money.

Reviews.Title: “A very well placed hotel and surprisingly quiet for a city centre”
Reviews.Author: teachef
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Superbreaks, mainly for its location. It is superbly situated, near to the Van Gogh museum and the Reiksmuseum, on the 1, 2 or 5 tramline which seem to run every 2 minutes. The staff on reception were efficient, though we did have to wait while they dealt with another person and answered phones, no big deal, and they did apologise for the wait. We were given a room on the front of the hotel and were a little worried that it might be noisy, but the efficient glazing meant that this was not a problem. The room was of a good size and the bathroom had a bath and shower over. Breakfast was included and it was a great assortment of hot and cold dishes including little dutch pancakes which were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: daisy1169
Reviews.Content: Spring break 2010~ I traveled with my parents and my 14yr old niece. We spent 9 days in Amsterdam. Our hotel was perfectly located right next to a tram line that got us all over the city. Check in was a bit rough, it was busy and they alot of late check outs that delayed our rooms. My room had a balcony and a great view of the eastern side of the city. A great place to people watch and have a cup of coffee. I do wish they had free wifi, but you can take your laptop across the street to MacDonalds and it's free :) I've stayed in 2 NH locations in Amsterdam and love the chain. They are helpful and vary clean, they also have elevators which is a huge bonus with older guests! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “worth its name”
Reviews.Author: monopteros
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few footsteps away from Leidseplein, the bars and restaurants area, the Vondelpark and other major attractions. A bike (by far the best way of transportation in this city) can be rented directly at the hotel reception, or surrounding bike rental shops. The room was quite big and nicely furnished. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall good value for the price, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, extremely clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: susancarey
Reviews.Content: This hotel located near to museums Rik and Van Gogh, together with Diamond factory. Directrly opposite is Leidsplein square where there are numerous restaurants and cafes. Can recommend Alfredos Steakhouse - beautiful steak, friendly staff and great atmosphere. The famous street for shopping starts here too. Outside hotel is Tram no 1 which takes you to Central Station, Dam Square, Flower market etc. You don't have to buy travel card as there are conductors at back of tram where you can pay 7euro for 24 hr pass. Across street and to right is a cafe/bar called Aran where they servce excellent breakfast for 10 euro. Can also recommend Cau Cau restaurant just off Dam Sq.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tf68
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean, and rooms were very good. Room service is also availble, with a fitness center and bar down stairs. Buffet breakfast was good i would definate get that included when staying there isnt alot open areound special on a sunday morning. out the front of the hotel is a tram and it takes you into the heart of amsterdam city, and it is also walkable maybe 10 - 15minutes. but it far away enough not to hear the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: domridley
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother went visited Amsterdam and we came across this hotel online. To be honest, it was everything we could have wished for. Great location, clean, spacious, comfortable, friendly and helpful staff and we even got a balcony. The location was great, about 15minutes walk to the red light district and the van gogh museum. Right outside are the busses to Schiphol Airport. We stayed there for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sjurontour
Reviews.Content: A good middle class hotel with great location in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: tssurya
Reviews.Content: We had gone to Amsterdam with Star tours for a 3 day tour. We were staying in NH Hotels for 2 â€Ždays. This hotel is just a 10 minutes drive away from the famous Kukenhof gardens, Amsterdam. â€ŽHotel is very huge so are the lounges, dining places etc.. Rooms were average size but very cosy. â€ŽThis hotel is within a landscape environment. Our room was next to a lovely small canal with ducks â€Žand vast flower beds beside it. It was very lovely. We could see a beautiful sun rise from our room. â€ŽShowers and toilets were clean and rooms are cleaned up every day. â€Ž Bar was quite expensive. It has a bar downstairs but very expensive. Breakfast variety was good. â€ŽInteriors have a very royal and luxurious look.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “To recomend”
Reviews.Author: monikamurer
Reviews.Content: Very good situated hotel, nice rooms. Different Sightseeing points are in walking distance and you can also find shopping possibilites. We also held (earlier) a meeting in the hotel. There we missed the customer orientation. We had to ask several times for the same things. Food in the breaks where good. Sometimes smells of smoke. Service sometimes very slow. Rooms are clean and o.k. for one or two nights. If you are NH member the check-in procedure goes faster. Breakfast is nice and I also had lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on good location”
Reviews.Author: BBB051
Reviews.Content: Was welcomed by highskilled people at the desk. Everyone speaks good English and you feel welcome. The room was spacious for a single room. Bathroom was well equipped. Location of the hotel is near a very busy Leidse plein. Lot's of restaurants and there are some interesting things to visit in the neighbourhood. Canalboat in front of hotel. Because it is so busy, I had some problems with the noise on the straat and square. My room was located near the street.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: IlGenio
Reviews.Content: Location is very central and walking distance to the heart of Amsterdam. Rooms are clean and spacious and the hotel lobby and common areas look very well kept and modern. The service in our opinion could have been better, the receptionists were not very kind and looked exhausted. We paid EUR 150 per night for a standard double room without breakfast - a bit expensive given the quality of the rooms. During week ends they allow late check out at 4pm which was extremely convenient for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tryasido
Reviews.Content: Great location, freindly staff, clean room, fantastic value! We got a great deal of Â£60 a night, stayed 5 nights and loved the freindly atmosphere in a lovely location with bars and resturaunts close by but very quiet room. One of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience - centrally located”
Reviews.Author: FLTravellerWithKids
Reviews.Content: We got there the day when Holland defeated Uruguay. The whole place was lively and we could experience this from the safety of the hotel. Our kids were also very welcome and the staff was great. We were upgraded to a suite. The room was very nice. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: pbfarfallina
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a nice place to stay upon arrival in Europe after an overnight flight from North America. We arrived early, before check-in time, and were offered a smoking room if we wanted to check-in early, as our requested non-smoking room was not ready yet. We gladly took the room, and the smoke smell was tolerable. The room had fairly powerful air conditioning, which mitigated the smokiness. Other than that, the room was clean and modern, the location is good, and we had no problems during our stay. We really liked the breakfast; it was one that was geared toward travelers from many parts of the world (northern and southern continental Europe, Britain, United States/Canada). There was even a special breakfast section for children -- in general the hotel seemed quite welcoming toward children.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Helpful, Friendly Staff in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenTurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for just one night and found the staff welcoming and very helpful. Our room was very nice, with comfy bed, sofa and excellent ensuite bathroom. All very clean and modern. Downside was that there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room and there was a charge for the tv. Breakfast was very good with a large selection of hot and cold dishes including fruit, cold cheeses & meat, cooked English, cereals, pastries & toast. There is a bar/restaurant which serves a small selection of dishes throughout the day. The hotel is on the edge of the centre, but is within walking distance of the sights plus there is a canal bus stop right outside. We certainly didn't find the location a problem and on the plus side it is quiet. Altogether I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Best staff!”
Reviews.Author: jsudre
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasant to stay at NH Amsterdam Centre Hotel from July 1 until July 5 during our honey moon trip! The hotel is great... Perfect! The people were so friendly and they were always willing to help us. We must give a special thanks to Donna Molenaar who is the NH Duty Manager. Her team decorated our room with several rose petals and a bottle of Champagne because of our honey moon! What a wonderful surprise! Other than that the hotel location was great! Very close to many restaurants and coffee shops in the Leidseplein area where you could find great food and entertainment. Also very close to Vondelpark and museums such as Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. And also closed to a good place where you can rent bikes. There is also a bus and train/tram stop in Leidseplein square... Very convenient... The room was modern, very clean and comfortable... We loved the duvet so much that we bought one in Bijenkorf store! The breakfast was good with several alternatives. There is also free wi-fi Internet access in the lobby of the hotel. We will definitely stay at NH Amsterdam Centre again!

Reviews.Title: “Good price good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lfgrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights average of $ 80 a night. Location was good, hotel was clean and nice. AC could work a little better but I am a spoiled American, was not hot in the room at all.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good location”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to all the other reviews. Modern interior, room quite small but very clean. The bed was quite soft though but the room has all the usual services; iron, safe, kettle, hair dryer, mini-bar. Web access is paid for, using the cable connection but you can get free WiFi in the lobby. There's also a free-to-use PC and printer in the lift lobby. Apart from a slight delay in getting our room, service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aridley21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found the hotel very clean and comfortable. The location was also excellent, not far from the city centre and within walking distance of museums and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for us”
Reviews.Author: ClaretAl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Friday-Monday. Got a great price via Priceline NYOP and cannot fault the hotel at all for what we paid. Check in staff friendly and efficient, superb location, clean, comfortable, modern, non smoking room. No view to speak of but to us quiet and comfort is more important and how long do you actually spend admiring the view from your bedroom window on a city break? Breakfast and mini bar were expensive but they are not compulsory and there are plenty of alternatives nearby. All in all we would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the perfet location”
Reviews.Author: RWills81
Reviews.Content: Close to Vondelpark and the museums along with busy Leidersplein for great food and entertainment. The hotel is nice, big, clean, safe and modern, much more of a business hotel but still very nice and very helpful. I got the place half price on priceline so the value was a bigger plus. Cross the canal and your in Leidersplein where there are plenty of people and great food of all different cultures. Would stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SamandDerek
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location right across from a canal. The lobby is nice and spacious and the bar downstairs is a great place to watch the World Cup! The breakfast buffet is ok, i've been to better in Europe. The check-in/check-out was a bit slow and there really don't seem to be enough staff working at the front desk - although the ones there were great! The room was clean and had a spacious bathroom. No flat screen tv, just your standard old kind. Bed was comfy and only had a duvet (typical in Europe). A/C worked fairly good but I did get a little warm at night.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip-off and most un-Amsterdam experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: 5starAussies
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointing and boring hotel. Asked for a great room considering we were paying over 200 euros a night and got a room with a brick wall view with people looking straight into our room. Twvo local phone calls $10, bottle of water $10aud It was so not value for money as we moved to a hotel on the canals great service free tea and coffee for half the price. Service was poor and we saw many travelers sitting around waiting for rooms. If you go here you're NUTS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: where2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago for a long weekend after getting this hotel via Priceline for a good price. I had a one night stay this month and stayed at this hotel again. The best thing for me about this hotel is the location. It's easy to get to the hotel from the airport by bus or by train/tram. This time I arrived at Centraal Station from Eindhoven so just took a tram to Leidseplein (the 1, 2, or 5 - a ten minute trip) and the hotel is a short walk from there. Getting around the city by tram is easy but the hotel is in a great location such that many things are a walk away (the museums, the park, the canal belt and so on). Check-in at the hotel was efficient (they accommodated my request for a double bed, despite me calling a few days before asking for a twin room!) The room was on the 6th floor overlooking the road towards Leidseplein. Noise was not an issue (the windows opened but even then, it wasn't terribly noisy). The room was fairly small but modern and very clean - in addition to the bed, there was an armchair, tables and television and that was about it. The bathroom was clean with a large shower area and good, powerful shower. Toiletries were included. At this hotel, you can call reception and choose from an array of different pillows to be brought to your room. They also have a late check-out on a Sunday (5pm I think from memory). I didn't use either of these as I was only staying for one night and it wasn't a Sunday. There is free WIFI in the lobby but not in the room. Overall, I was pleased with my stay in this hotel and it met my expectations, in the same way as for my previous stay a year ago. There's nothing to particularly rave about but it ticks most boxes at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel NH Amterdam Centre”
Reviews.Author: crazyjaney9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and were very happy with the location. Just off the canal belt. Easy to walk to shopping and many restaurants. We had a large room on top floor, very large for European standards. Only complaint NO Drawers to put your clothes. We left them in the suitcase. In such a large room you would think they could have a dresser so you can empty your suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Super location with a tidy, compact room: very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Linssen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance from everything, and we did most everything there is to do all on foot. The weather was glorious while we were there, but the air con had broken, so it was very hot in the room. The staff were all polite and helpful though, and did what they could. Nice little room, with everything you might need. It's just away enough from the lively squares and cafes that it's quiet at night. We had a fantastic time there.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven but Ultimately Good”
Reviews.Author: Fairblonde
Reviews.Content: This stay started out very poorly on a Sunday when the hotel staff made their guests wait an hour or so after checkin time before rooms were ready. For grumpy international travelers, it was a mess, and the crisp accents behind the desk didn't seem to care about the grumblers in the lobby. I immediately recognized this as a total tourist hotel, interested in shoveling them in and packing them out. Indeed, when rooms became available, they were offered not to those waiting but whomever was at the desk at the time, and the first room I got was wrong - a smoking one (#307). It was small, the couch had a large burn on it, and it stunk horribly. I asked to be moved and was given a large, nonsmoking L-shaped room looking out over the popular Leidesplein. Much better. That unpleasantry out of the way, this room (#209) was quite nice, especially considering I'd bid $100. night thru Priceline and asked for a 4-star hotel. The style was modern and spare, the sitting furniture acceptable, but the bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was very very modern and featured a wonderful shower with two heads - nice! I ordered a sandwich from room service, and found its Croque Monsieur very tasty and reasonably priced. I should also mention that when my room safe stopped working, the manager came up to assist, and he looked like a cross between James Bond and Prince Charming with a French accent. Fortunately, he too had trouble with the safe, making me feel a lot better about the problem and allowing me the pleasure of his company a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “THE worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Shellybeirne
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were tiny, and dirty. The children found tablets under table in their room, which had not been properly cleaned. The staff were proffesional enough, but certainly not friendly. and the bar was like a morgue at night time I would never stay in any NH hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great central location - clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: cnib06
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just opposite the Leidseplein so really central for bars and restaurants and five minutes walk to the museum quarter so an ideal location for tourists. The room was a bit cosy - just enough room to get around our bags but everything was new and it had a nice modern bathroom with bath and was very quiet at night. Only downside to the hotel is the pricey breakfast and extras we bought breakfast elsewhere every day. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with lots of space and big bathroom”
Reviews.Author: heodeza
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel: clean and light room, with plenty of space, delicious breakfast and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: chemmie
Reviews.Content: Take tram 1, 2 or 5 to Liedsplein and the hotel is just across the street. Walking distance to the very touristy area and all of the shops, but it is easy enough to get away from all of that if you want. Also a short walk to the Van Gogh Museum and other museums. Easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam from here. There is an Ah grocery store and another gourmet grocery store right around the corner and tons of places to eat, though I don't recommend the places right at Liedsplein. Staff was friendly, spoke perfect English, and got us in as quickly as possible. Rooms were very clean. We had two rooms and one was huge, the other was smaller but still comfortable. No complaints at all about this hotel. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mvanarsdale
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are looking for a spot with comfortable beds and a good breakfast. Rooms are quite small but that is the norm in Amsterdam. Very clean with good service and a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great value for super clean hotel near museums and fun stuff in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: texantraveler4
Reviews.Content: We paid 99 euros per night for this hotel that was clean, quiet, very nice--and also in a location perfect to visit both the Van Gogh museum (about 5 blocks) and just across the street from the Leidse Square and only a block from an entrance to the Vondelpark. I was travelling with my adult daughter and we were pleasantly surprised that the room came with two very comfy twin beds as well as several armchairs and a coffee table. Our window overlooked a beautiful courtyard. We were just close enough to the action without it keeping us up at night--it truly was a peaceful retreat with great soundproofing. It's right next to the Marriott which was charging much more for what couldn't be much nicer. The one thing I didn't like was that to use the free wifi, you had to go to the hotel lobby. You can get the internet in your room, but you have to pay a stiff surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “My choice every time I go to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mcmiku
Reviews.Content: Each time I have a chance to go to Amsterdam I choose this hotel for it's location and the fact there is never a bad surprise. As a regular customer, you start to feel at home quite quickly and notice the very friendly staff has little turnover and you always see a familiar face. Superior rooms are nice. If you are there for a long business trip think about taking the 7day internet access pass. Laundry service is great and front office staff is always willing to help and have you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: elle9904
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline (name your own price) to get a hotel for my holiday in Amsterdam. I ended up at the NH Amsterdam for $75/night for two nights. The location was fabulous, the staff was friendly and helpful. Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: colin126
Reviews.Content: really good hotel,location is spot on,could not say a bad word about it..stayed here twice now,and going back in july again..been lucky to get it on priceline for a great rate...thats the place to go

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: ENC3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 5-8 with a deal from Priceline ($67 a night!). The hotel was very modern and clean. We were in room 128 (I think?) and it was one floor up from the lobby along the front of the hotel. We definitely could hear noise outside, but it wasn't bothersome at all. It was nice, actually, to have such a good view of what was going on around us. Our room was small, with a queen bed and two nightstands filling the entire wall. There was a small couch at the end of the bed, and a desk/wardrobe on the wall opposite the bed. The bathroom was standard size and had a very nice shower/tub and was very clean. Toiletries were included (but no conditioner), as was hair dryer. The bed was slightly awkward, as I ended up rolling toward the middle of the bed since I'm the lighter of myself and my travel partner. The location was also very good -- we walked to the Anne Frank house one morning and it was well within 15 minutes. The entire city center was actually very walkable and although we were close to the trams, we walked almost everywhere. The staff were helpful and offered to store our bags while we waited for our room to be ready the first day we checked in. They also helped us with directions and questions we had. I was also very impressed with the security -- after certain hours, you had to have your key to enter the front door into the lobby and also to get in the elevator. I would certainly stay there again, especially if I got such a deal on Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Very good Value”
Reviews.Author: stltravelers2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Mar6-8. Got a great deal on NYOP on priceline, $68 per night before fee. The staff was very helpful with directions and the location of the hotel was very close to the tram system. Everything in this hotel seemed like a typical chain hotel which was fine for the very limited time we would actually spend in the room. The internet was a bit expensive, I didn't use it. We did not try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK - nothing more / nothing less”
Reviews.Author: dutchboy81
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as wanted to feel what the NH experience was like. To be honest, was a little disappointed with the above hotel. When we arrived the upselling (to Deluxe rooms) was done so aggressively it almost felt that the standard rooms were simply not worthy of our stay. We stood our ground though and got 3 rooms in total. 1 was a smoking (which is a positive thing as not many hotels in Amsterdam still have these rooms) The room however wasn't anything special... The night before I stayed at the Mercure Aan de amstel (review on this hotel to follow) and to be honest if that location would be in the same place as the NH Amsterdam Centre, no doubt I would have gone for that hotel as the rooms were kinda similar but with just nicer touches... The rooms in the NH Amsterdam Centre just do not match the expectancy for some reason, but nevertheless I guess it has all you need in a good 4* hotel. The breakfast on the other hand (which was included in our rate) was of SUPERB quality. (finally it seems that Iberia staff use this hotel as their main base when on overnights to Amsterdam - Spanish hotel chain / Spanish airline OF COURSE - and these crews are soooo incredibly rude when passing you in the lift or corridors and will not even acknowledge you when you hold the liftdoor open for them and simply expect you to wait or be prepared to be shouted at in Spanish. Anyway, in general I could stay at this hotel again but only if the price is right, cause otherwise I wold be just as happy at one of the many other hotels Amsterdam counts.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend on grounds of location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: OurMrsReynolds
Reviews.Content: Great location in the museum district; 5 minutes from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum (perfect for getting there first thing in the morning and avoiding the queues). Also very near a wonderful vegetarian restaurant called, something like, De Waggles. Our room overlooked a very quiet, rather pretty side street. The room was well decorated and very comfortable and certainly appeared clean. The bathroom was also well laid out, but the toilet had not been cleaned properly and the bathroom fan was not working, leaving us with no secrets from each other. The staff were eager to help with directions and such and the room included a free map and hotel copy of a guide book, which were helpful. Excellent value for money and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Ricoireland
Reviews.Content: On arrival to this hotel, i was delighted with location, the hotel seemed nice and the man on reception was pleasant and helpful. We had booked two smoking rooms, one which was fine but the other one had a very unpleasant smell and certainly was not stale smoke. i checked the mini bar which you would not call clean. I informed reception who sent quiet a rude man to the room who looked around saying he could not smell anything, he then looked into the mini bar and said that the smell was cigar smoke. After what seems like ages i was tranfered to another room and within 10 minutes, i had a delivery of a sanitary towel! which i had in no way asked for and i believe was some sort of a practicle joke by the hotels staff. the following day, both our rooms were sent a letter stating that we are not to be smoking marijuana in our rooms! On checking out, a rude receptionist asked us had we used the mini bar, we said no and she then said that she was getting them checked. After 15 minutes, i was told it had being checked. after a following 30 mins, the receptionist who was dealing with us never came back, so we had to go to another woman who continued our checkout and apologised for the delay. I would certainly not reccomend this hotel to anyone. The hotels few good staff are certainly overshadowed by the inexperience and unprofessionalism of others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location for nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: NikNIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located for nightlife, plenty of restaurants and bars in the nearby square, close to museums and about 10-15 min walk to Dam Square. Bus from airport drops off right accross the road, only costs 3.60 euros. Staff kindly upgraded us FOC to a superior room as we were celebrating my 40th birthday, the room was huge with sofa and two armchairs as well as a huge bed. Staff helpful, shower cap and shaving kit supplied on request and they also emptied the mini bar to allow us to store our own supplies. We booked through priceline's name your own price for Â£50pn and were more than pleased with the allocated hotel. We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find anything wrong”
Reviews.Author: MrJohnMd
Reviews.Content: I just finished 14 days at this property. All on a Priceline NYOP solo vacation. The good: The bed was great. A good size regular queen. The room and hotel was very quiet. No matter the time of day. Size of the double room was very nice. The staff, and I had contact with many of them, were quite good and very friendly. The breakfast has dropped its price to 19 euros. I splurged 3 times. Did most of my days eating and drinking of coffee and juice at one sitting on those 3 days. Spent virtually nothing the rest of the day on food or drink. 15 min of free computer is a nice touch. Bath room was very nice. Switched rooms once just for a change. Shower only in one. Shower and tub is the 2nd. A person with mobility issues will not want a tub. Quite high to get out of. Never had a problem with too little hot water. Location is great. Hard to beat. The bad: TV selection in English is just OK. The TV is just OK. No big flat screen here. Pretty hard to think of anything else to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.!”
Reviews.Author: willowinie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 27th to 30th 09. had no booking, just walked and got a good deal. Staff were friendly and helpful, No problems about viewing the room before commiting to the stay (Recommended)Nice canal views and centrally located,close too museums,Vondel park and canal boat trips right across from hotel. Nice!.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money & great location!”
Reviews.Author: FRWorldCitizen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during NYE 2010 for an average of 160â‚¬/night breakfast not included. Very nice hotel ideally located, between Leidseplein - one of the busiest areas of Amsterdam with its numerous shops, fast-food joints, bars, and night clubs - and the museum quarter, within walking distance to the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum and the luxury stores of P.C. Hooftstraat. Also just nearby Vondelpark, perfect spot if you like running! Tram station for lines 1, 2, 5 right in front of the hotel so you can easily reach the Dam Square and downtown area. Standard rooms are clean and spacious with an extremely comfortable queen bed, a large desk area, a closet, a full-sized bathroom, a shower with 2 heads, lights turn on and off with the key card, also available is a hot water kettle and supplies for instant coffee and tea. Bar fridge, safe, iron, sat tv, all very functional. Wifi on request. The staff are helpful and speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad”
Reviews.Author: rognan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located but too expensive. The service is very bad, our reservation was lost, we got a very bad room, hotel personnel was very rude and charged my credit card double by mistake. It took a long time to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ingush
Reviews.Content: Great location, our room had a queen bed with queen mattress- not two beds pushed together - shower had two heads - like a rain shower - excellent after a long flight! Also the rate was attractive compare to the hotels in Amsterdam that was found on www.lastminutetravel.com. We will defenetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jayluv69
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating. We checked in 6hr before check in time. Very Nice Staff and great Location. It was in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: SDMcGee
Reviews.Content: The tram number 5 takes will take you to the hotel from the Centraal Station in Amsterdam. We were greeted warmly by the staff and given a room overlooking the canal across the road. They offered to empty the mini bar so we could store some needed supplies in the fridge. The bed was extremely comfortable. I liked the dark wood (pergo) floors contrasting with the light furniture, it was easy to navigate the room in the middle of the night. Our room was large enough with comfortable chair and footstools. A full sized bathroom and plenty of hot water. The lights turn on and off with the key card so there is no wasting of electricity. Room came equipped with a hot water kettle and supplies for instant coffee and tea. There's really not a lot to say that hasn't been said about this place. It was very clean and easily located. The neighborhood is full of places to eat and plenty to do with the museums within an easy walk. While this hotel isn't in the center of town it's very handy to all sights and it's quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone for quality of service and a clean and comfortable room. We had one small problem, that is barely worth mentioning but it was handled promptly, professionally and quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Restful Stay at a Fantastic Price”
Reviews.Author: sagittarianrealm
Reviews.Content: We liked the general area from the moment we emerged from the 197 airport bus, although we were not wowed by the hotel's rather bland modern facade. Our accommodation was not available at 11 a.m. but we were allowed store our luggage. ROOM Dark wood furniture and timber floor; large comfy double bed; a pillow menu (we did not avail of this); old style television; work desk; blackout curtains; iron/ironing board; electronic safe (no charge); excellent general lighting and reading lights which were adjustable to the angle of your choice; mini bar (did not use); nicely illustrated Guide book entitled "Amsterdam Insight"; individually controlled air-conditioning and heating; electric jug kettle; cups; sugar; Pickwicks tea-bags and Douwe Egberts coffee sachets. We had a standard non-smoking room on the fifth floor to the back with a nice view of Vondelkerk (former church). However, carpet in the corridor was worn and stained. Keycard was needed for lift on ground floor, room door, and entrance to hotel late at night. Reception was open 24 hours. BATHROOM This was compact but had an excellent bath/shower combination. Also provided were shampoo and shower gel with citrus aromas; soap with orange extract (very nice); box of tissues; soft white terry towels with guidance for eco friendly use;- a mirror proclaiming it had seen a lot of faces and a smiling face was always beautiful! Shower initially a little tricky to use, but maybe that's just me! GENERAL Buffet breakfast was not included, but we simply made tea and enjoyed a continental breakfast in our room. We shopped in the nearby Albert Heijn Supermarket, 116-124 Overtoom (open till 10 pm except Sundays). At lunchtime we ate at La Place, Kalverstraat/Rokin and The Soup Kitchen, Niewendijk 50 (near Central Station). Had evening dinner not far from the hotel at Hap Hmm (means yummy bite), Eerste Helmerstaat 33, a cosy restaurant frequented by locals- a recommendation in itself. Incidentally, just across the street is a Lidl store. All our eateries were very reasonably priced. We used the free internet in the new and very spacious public library at 143, Oosterdokskade 143 (east of Central Station). It's open 10am - 10pm, 7 days a week. There are great views of the city from the 7th floor. Amsterdam is pancake flat and compact so walking around is a joy if the days are not wet. We also purchased a Strippenkaart at Schiphol Airport information desk. Price is â‚¬7.30 for 15 strips or â‚¬4.80 if you are aged 65 or over. Five strips, stamped by the driver, will bring you to the hotel and is valid for trams or buses for 1.5 hours. Two persons (or more) can use the same Strippenkaart. CONCLUSION Hotels in Amsterdam are expensive. Slightly worried by the fact that most of the one-star or two-star hotels have very steep and narrow stairs, without lifts, we took the advice of the TripAdvisor Amsterdam Experts, who give so freely of their time and knowledge to try Priceline "name your own price" site for four-star or five-star hotels. Result - our stay made all the sweeter by getting a double room for just under â‚¬60 per night when the non-refundable rate on Booking.com for a similar room averaged â‚¬177 per night. We really are indebted to you guys! Our favourite moments in Amsterdam: Alfred Stephens Exhibition in Van Gogh Museum (until January 24th, 2010); Jordaan area and the vivid green parakeet birds on the leafy treetops in Vondelstraat, who seemed so excited by our visit. Hope you too enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple but clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times in the superior rooms of NH Amsterdam Centre. For nightlife this hotel has the perfect location, 3 minutes walking from Leidsesquare (Leidseplein) with lots of bars, discos, restaurants, shopping. The rooms are simple but really clean and comfortable. Also the staff at (I guess) every NH Hotel is really great!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, overworked front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Siam-Orchids
Reviews.Content: decent hotel, good location, overworked front desk staff with a poor attitude. But I'd stay there again because it's convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, Small Bed”
Reviews.Author: pmohanram
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific - at the start of the "canal" portion of Amsterdam, and five minutes from the Rijks and Van Gogh museums. The hotel lobby is nice and rooms are very spacious. Even though our room faced the street, noise was not a big deal. The only drawback is that the beds are small (supposedly queen but seem smaller) - normally my wife, I and our six year old share a bed with ease in most hotels, but couldnt here and their charges for a rollaway were outrageous. Also, the reception staff while helpful, were not too knowledgeable about places to eat at, directions around and about etc. If you get this place on Priceline (like I did for a steal of 90 USD a night after all taxes), you should be happy with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline (Â£52 pn) for a weekend break. It's 3 minutes walk from Leidesplein and a short distance from the Van Gogh museum / Rijksmuseum. The whole city is relatively easy walking distance, but trams are nearby as are the Canalbus boats. We took the 197 bus in from the airport as advised by others on TA, direct into Leidesplein in 30 minutes (buy a Strippenkart from a newsagent when you arrive - cheaper than paying the driver). Check-in was very accommodating and moved us to a larger room. The carpet in the 3rd floor. hallway was badly stained and worn. The room itself was clean, with hardwood floors, minibar, TV, ironing board, and of reasonable size. The bed was comfortable, although it was two twin beds pushed together, and which had a habit of sliding apart and depositing you on the wooden floor, not very romantic! The bathroom was clean, with a good shower in a bath. All in all, can recommend as a comfortable stay and good value on Priceline, but perhaps not at full rate.

Reviews.Title: “we will always have Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: RuxandraB
Reviews.Content: Location is great: tram station in front of the hotel so you can easy reach the Dam Square and other major points of interest, Bulldog coffe shop, canal cruise accros the street, park, restaurants, even cheap shops, almost everything you can wish for. We stayed for 4 nights and we had a problem with the bathroom sink and they just could not fix it at all! Otherwise, it was ok. We had a superior room, incredible large, but small bathroom. They brought us warm milk for my son (3y3m), every evening, free of charge. At breakfast you have plenty of choices, for adults and kids. You must try the chocolate in small boxes (spread it on a buttered slice of bread), They have very late check out on Sunday (5 pm)!!! It is quite difficult to find a cab on the street, so ask the concierge to call one for you. I strongly recomend the Zoo, with or without children, the canal cruise, if the weather is fine (it means no rain!) and a trip to Haga (aprox 1 h by train) to see Madurodam and walk on the beach. Pay very much attention to the bycicles! Of course we ll come back next year at the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Chain Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because of a winning bid on Priceline, so that really colors my perspective. For the price I paid, this was a steal and an excellent value. I arrived early and they offered me a smoking room which was great! I thought those were extinct. I'm under the impression that the 3rd floor is smoking rooms. The room was small by American standards, but not too small for comfort. The room is dark, with dark wood flooring and dark furniture, so it becomes a little "cave-like" if you don't have much of a view. Not sure if I got the "Priceline Room" but my window looked out into an office building across an alley way. The bed was a true queen size and very comfortable, bathroom was also small but modern and very clean. The Bath/Shower was great, but is rather high up from the floor, so getting out of it is tricky if you are all wet. Because I got the room on priceline, I didn't get any extras with the room, such as breakfast or internet access and the hotel seems to charge alot for these extras. Even the gym was extra. (The gym was more of a fitness room and not really a gym, to be charged admittance for this is just plain silly greed. I went to a real Gym a few blocks away Splash Fitness, and for the same price got all the amenities that a real gym offers.) Internet access is similarly priced restrictively, so most days I went to a restaurant with free wifi and my laptop. They have 2 restaurants and a bar, again, priced out of whack with neighboring bars and restaurants, so saw no need to try them when the liedersplein is just a minute away. (Also in 5 days I never saw anyone actually eat or drink there). The front desk people were fine and mostly helpful, although they did lead me astray on some public transport intructions. Maid service was excellent and honored my do not disturb sign. (Even when I didn't wake up until 2:30pm the first day! They came in after they were sure I was gone). The location is excellent for visiting the Museumplein, VondelPark, The leidersplein, Rembrentplein and tram service is just outside the front entrance. I think if I had paid the normal rate for this place I would be very very dissappointed with the level of amenities and service, but if you can get this hotel at a Priceline bid rate, you will have yourself a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, less than average 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubytues23
Reviews.Content: We couldn't of asked for a better location! It's very close to Leidesplein and tons of shopping and restaurants. It's also very close to Vondelpark, the museums, and the Heineken brewery. It's just a block away from the extremely crowded areas, so it still is quiet - and it's not in the seedy area near Centraal Station or the redlight district. If it weren't advertised as a 4-star hotel, I would of been very pleased with this hotel, but unfortunately it did not live up to its expectations. Thank goodness I did not pay full price for it though, as I booked it on priceline. It mentions that it offers many things on the website (bike rental, free continental breakfast, free wifi, etc) which it most certainly did not. If we wanted breakfast there it would of been 25 euro! There also is a nearby bike rental place near Leidesplein but it doesn't always have bikes readily available. There is one computer available in the "business center" - aka the elevator lobby - which you can get free 15 minute vouchers from the front desk. Also, for Americans, the service at this place is not good. The employees are not too friendly, or accommodating. We booked the hotel through priceline, but they would not offer the same rate for extra nights. They offered more than twice(!) our rate as their lowest option, which obviously we did not take. Also, when I got home I noticed that they charged me for an extra night on my credit card - for no reason!! I had to call them to have it sorted out, which was not too fun! All in all, if you can get a good rate for this hotel then go for it - it's worth it if you can get it cheaply! I would definitely not recommend this hotel if you are paying full price for it though!!

Reviews.Title: “Good city centre location”
Reviews.Author: airedale1
Reviews.Content: comfortable hotel in good city centre location with friendly staff - nice views over amsterdam canal

Reviews.Title: “Good (ish)”
Reviews.Author: Hamish989
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It's a comfortable hotel. It's almost well located. The 5* status that it holds however is only as result of cramming as many different facilities and assorted room accessories in as possible and is in no way reflective of this being a luxurious hotel. My partner and I went to Amsterdam for a long weekend. The hotel was suggested by Lastminute.com as one of their luxury 5* secret properties, the name of which would only be revealed once payment has been made and the booking secure. It is approximately E35 from the airport to the hotel by taxi and it is well located for the Rijks Museum (currently closed for refurbishment) and the Albert Cuyp market (seemingly consiting entirely of stalls selling either cheap wigs, cheap (and nasty) leather goods and the odd cheese stall). First impressions of the hotel were that the room (standard) was on the small side. There was no bath in the ensuite but there was a good sized walk in shower, with underpowered shower heads. The staff were not all that friendly and seemed rather bemused when I called down to the front desk one evening to request the turn down service, which they told me that they didn't do. This is something that I am used to getting in 5* hotels and also something that they advertise as being offered in the inroom service guide book. When this was pointed out to the receptionist she tried to tell me that the service directory in our room must be wrong. The hotel is located at the opposite end of the city to the old town and took about 30 minutes to walk there, although this was no real problem as the walk was pleasant enough. All in all I would recommend the NH Amsterdam Centre (just). The way in which I booked it through Lastminute.com meant that the rate was Â£70 per night which was just about right at 50% less than the normal rate. Had I paid the full rate then I would have been extremely critical of the level of service that we received. I would only use this hotel again if I received a similar 50% reduction on the usual room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: sankhya
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this NH property several times for business trips over the last few years, so when we decided to make a holiday trip to Amsterdam (along with day trips), this seemed like a good and familiar choice. Close to Leidesplein, it is within walking distance to sights and restaurants, but away from the hurly-burly of the Central Station or Rembrandtplein areas. I have always been happy with the people at this NH---and I swear they haven't changed in over 5 years!. The tricky thing about this hotel is room size. Some are roomy, some are closet-sized. I have had a variety, all in the same price category. I haven't a clue how they figure out their price ranges, so this time I got wise and requested a larger room beforehand. (I booked online). I also reiterated this request when I checked in. We had room 119, a corner room (see photos); it was quite spacious. Request this one if you can. The double bed is not two beds smashed together, either. Furnishings are spartan, but that's an NH thing. When I've been on business (read: expense account), I also had my breakfast included because it is such an impressive spread. However, since we were on vacation, we would just go to nearby pancake houses. The NH is not for the super budget-conscious, but I think it's just as good as the nearby Marriott, at quite a bit less. (I collect a lot of hotel points so I almost considered the Marriott this time, but trust me, the rooms aren't worth the difference in cost. If I came to Amsterdam for leisure again, I would probably stay here, but I also might shop around a little first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristy31
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel - stayed for two nights at the end of May in a suite. Travelling partner was my spouse and this was our second time visiting Amsterdam. We were looking for a nice, centrally located hotel. Here's what we thought: LOCATION: Couldn't ask for better! One very short tram ride from Central Station and walking distance to almost everything. It is located almost right on Leidesplein (one of the main squares) and therefore very central for all entertainment and touristy stuff. It is on the same street as the Rijksmuseum/Museum District (walking: 10min) and the Heineken Experience (> 20 min). The Albert Cuyp Market is about a 25 min walk. The Red Light district is about the same...maybe a little longer at night with all the foot traffic. SERVICE: Amazing. We flew into AMS on a red-eye (arriving at 6 am). The front desk allowed us to check in early at about 8:00 am. Just ask - if they have an available room they will allow you to check in. This part is for the ladies: I had an unexpected "visitor" late at night (AKA no pharmacy/store open) - I called down to the desk and they had someone send some supplies up to our room. ROOM: Spacious and clean - what more could you want? Your choice of several different types of pillow? OK they offer that too! Isn't that great. You can keep the pillows provided in the room or request one of the several other kinds sent up for you instead. A 'menu' of the different pillows will be in your room. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. Nice desk area which was partioned from the bed area. Also nice sitting area. Bar fridge, safe, iron, sat tv, all very functional. Wifi on request. BATHROOM: Most importantly it was clean. There were also great soaps, shampoo, etc. Lovely actually. Nice shower with good pressure and a hair dryer. OVERALL: We would definitely stay at this hotel again and will the next time we go to Amsterdam. Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location, and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: BASWIMMER
Reviews.Content: The sign for the hotel is hard to see from a distance, but it is next to the Marriott which has a huge sign. The room is spacious and nicely decorated. I particularly like the big, bright bathroom. I arrived at 9 a.m. and the front desk gladly checked me in early. It was efficient and painless. The elevator to the guest floors requires key card to access. There are many English TV channels. The location is very good with museums, parks, restaurants, and public transportation within 1-2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: robs4219
Reviews.Content: First off, there are two NH hotels in Amsterdam with similar names (NH Amsterdam Centre and NH Amsterdam City Centre), so check that you have the correct address and if taking a taxi, ensure that the driver knows which hotel youâ€™re going to. The taxi fare should be fairly cheap from Amsterdam Centraal Station, maybe around 10 Euro. Arriving from Amsterdam Centraal station is fairly easy on Trams 1, 2 or 5. Just get off at the Leidseplein stop and look for the hotel across the street. The hotel is located on a fairly busy street right at the end of the Leidseplein area, which is full of bars and drunk/rowdy/obnoxious tourists. Otherwise the location is very convenient, with several trams available just across the street. The staff were helpful and spoke excellent English (as does apparently everyone in Holland). The concierge gave excellent restaurant advice and provided a map, so be sure to ask for recommendations before you end up eating at any of the mediocre and overpriced spots around Leidseplein. Avoid the pancake/crepe restaurant across the street near the canal; the food is horribly overpriced and geared towards tourists. The room was quite good, spacious enough with all the amenities youâ€™d expect (A/C, in-room safe, etc.). Instead of a king-sized bed it was simply two doubles pushed together, but thatâ€™s normal enough in Europe. We faced the front of the hotel and had a beautiful canal view. All in all, everything about the stay was excellent, although I would consider this to be more of a 4-star hotel than the 5-star that they claim. We booked through Priceline, so the room was definitely worth the price was paid.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, great location”
Reviews.Author: petziboo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Amsterdam. He was on a business trip which lasted from the end of June until July 6. We booked this hotel through Travelocity.com for 11 nights. Some positive things about the hotel are great location, modern furnishing and some extra comfort, more specifically an extra pillow, a robe and a pair of slippers. If you intend to stay for a short term in the midst of Amsterdamâ€™s tourist life, this hotel may meet your expectations. But beware, things are not as they seem. We received a bill at the end of our stay that shocked us. They charged us 7 days at the maximum rate when we knew for sure that this rate applied only for the 2 weekends. When we tried to explain, the receptionist pretended that she did not understand us. The manager was standing right next to her but did not introduce herself and just instructed the receptionist in Dutch to bring up the concern with the company we booked the hotel through. Also, my husband had a late flight so we asked whether he can check out 2 hours later than the regular check out time. They wanted to charge us 50 Euros. There was not even an offer to store his luggage as an alternative. Finally, from their website one can easily assume that Internet is provided. Well, it is not and their plans are totally inadequate to meet business needs. The price of the breakfast is exaggerated and you end up paying 2.5 times the amount of an Irish breakfast just across the bridge in the plaza. If you inquire about information that provides alternatives such as cheaper ways to get to attractions you are faced with ambiguous and hardly helpful answers from the concierge. Clearly, there are some management problems that have a significant negative affect on customer care which is a pity because this hotel has a great potential.

Reviews.Title: “NH Group - Very Disappointing :(”
Reviews.Author: travellerKB
Reviews.Content: Booked the 5 star NH amsterdam hotel directly through the NH Website. Upon arrriving at the hotel i was told that my booking wasnt valid even tho i booked it in April!! I explained how i had a confirmation booking but they didnt want to hear. I was told my hotel room was given away because we didnt book in before 4pm. This was never mentioned at any stage to me, the hotel manager called the NH group who said to give me another hotel so thats what we had to do. Ended up staying in another hotel which was nice but very noisy. The offer i got was a manager special.....it was special alright. I didnt even get to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vic-anne
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and could not fault it in any way. Flew easyjet with only hand luggage so relied on hotel to provide toiletries and they did, even providing my husband with a shaving kit (free of charge) Also provided slippers in room and adaptor plug (as I had forgotten mine!) Breakfast was included in our deal and there was lots of choice and a great coffee machine! weather was HOT, HOT, HOT so was very pleased air conditioning was quiet as we had it on through the night. Had a room on floor 2 and very peaceful, no traffic noise. Hotel was very clean and nicely furnished with a modern design. Amsterdam was great, hotel located just across from a canal with boat trips and near all the bars and restaurants with the Hard Rock Cafe opposite. Great holiday - will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: cuteontariocouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights at the end of May. Arrived at 2pm and the room was not ready. Would have been nice to check in after a long flight but left our bags and checked in later. 2nd floor very small room, cramped with a view of the air duct system. Very modern and clean with a good sized bathroom, comfortable bed. The location is excellent, right across from Leidseplein with lots of food and drink options and a short walk to Museumplein and Vondelpark. It is an easy tram ride or long walk to other sights near Centraal station or Jordaan. If you ask at the front desk they will give you a code for 15 minutes on the internet but it would have been nice if they had offered a map of the city. One negative: The bathtub is very deep and hard to step out of safely. I injured my foot on the metal plug in the middle of the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: dquah
Reviews.Content: Got our room from priceline at SGD130 for 3 nites. Room condition was excellent. Fittings are new & clean. The in-check staff was friendly & very helpful. We left our folder with all our hotel bookings on the check-in table. Didn't even notice that it was missing until we found it slipped under our door when we got back from our outing. But the window open up to another building so there is not much view of speak of but anyway, we don't spend much time in the room either. Would definitely stay at NH Amsterddam Centre again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MickBaby8
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline and this was well worth the US$70/night we paid. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked two rooms as there were 4 of us and they were very accomodating in getting a queen bed for my husband and I, two beds for our two friends and getting our rooms as close together as possible (we were on the same floor not too far apart). The concierge was great too when I asked about getting a map pointing out to me where we were and the points of interest that were close by and also letting me know that the hotel rents out bikes if we were interested. The rooms were comfortable, nothing super fancy but nicely decorated. They had a few tourist type magazines in the room which was great as I love going through those when I first arrive at a city I've never been to. A note - they do not provide conditioner (just shampoo and soap) so if you need it be sure to bring your own. The location was pretty good, it's right across the street from Leidesplein which is a happening square with cafes/bars and a very good selection of restaurants and its at the beginning of one of the main shopping streets, the Leidsestraat. There is also a Hop On Hop Off Canal Bus stop right in front of the hotel. On our third day we rented a car and the car rental place (National) was only a couple blocks away from our hotel which was great. However, the hotel is a good 20-30 mins walk from some other main areas such as Centraal Station; Red Light district; Anne Frank house.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulSYork
Reviews.Content: Having booked through Priceline with little knowledge about the NH chain, it's fair to say that I was slightly anxious about what I would find on arrival. There was no need. The hotel was nicely located, about 10-15 minutes walk from the 'centre' of Amsterdam but within only 2 minutes or so from some excellent bars, restaurants and coffee shops (although avoid the New York Steak House like the plague - we placed an order and after 30 minutes, the waiter re-appeared to apologise for 'forgetting to put the order through, despite having only 4 tables to deal with!). There were no problems with noise and our room was spacious, comfortable and exceptionally clean. Staff were very pleasant and always willing to help. I can't comment on the quality of the food served in the hotel as we always preferred to find somewhere in town. At 25 euros each for breakfast, however, I would seriously encourage any guest to take the short walk across the road to the nearby pancake restaurant. Have one served with pineapple - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: twist27
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated on Stadhouderskade just south of Leidseplein. It is easily reached from Central Station by taking the number 1,2 or 5 tram to Leidseplein. I had a standard room which would of been a good size anywhere but for Amsterdam this is big. The double bed was comfortable (there is a selection of pillows available to suit your preference) The Bathroom was small but well kept with a good shower. the room had T.V (BBC1 and 2 available) internet access (surcharge) tea/coffee making facilities, mini bar, iron and ironing board, bathrobe and slippers. The room was cleaned every day. The staff were friendly and helpful. Vondel park north entrance is just a couple of hundred metres away and the Rijksmuseum is within easy walking distance. There is a tram stop for the #1 tram directly outside the hotel or walk up to Leidseplein for more tram options. I managed to get a real bargain for this hotel and if the price was right I would not hesitate to stay here again. To sum up a great hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed in Europe”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMax
Reviews.Content: After our 14 our flight it was great to come to this hotel. The bed was amazingly comfortable and a good size and everyone was very nice. The breakfast buffet was very good. Probably the only good food in Amsterdam. It was alittle pricey but good luck finding anything better. It did get a little hot in the room. We just opened the window and it seemed to cool down fast. So it was worth it. Also it was very nice that they let us keep our bags there after check out. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbhb4l
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and quiet. Hotel was within a quick walk to all of the late night spots in Amsterdam. We walked from the hotel to the Red Light District and to eat really convienent. Very nice and clean and the staff was polite and orderly. Even more than we could have asked for. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelguyNYC75
Reviews.Content: The NH Amsterdam hotel is just off Leidseplein squre in Amsterdam. This makes the hotel few minutes (walk) away from all city attractions. This is a truely delux hotel (though 5 stars would suggest luxury). Rooms are very nicely appointed and the bathrooms are quite large. It's recommended to pay the upgrade to a superior rooms. The difference in size is significant. Hotel's gym is rather small but can be deemed efficient. The only thing at this hotel that bothered me is the "milking cow" policy. Mind you, breakfast cost here 25 Euros per person and every visit to gym is 12.5 Euros. Reasonable? I don't think so! In total, the NH Amsterdam Centre is a very well located hotel with a very high standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “So many things wrong...”
Reviews.Author: pjosep
Reviews.Content: Here are the many (mostly) small things that built up over time to really frustrate me at the NH Amsterdam Centre: In general, they would give me incorrect information, but with such certainty as if they were 100% sure with their answer. I personally consider this lying: 1. When I checked in, the lady at the front desk informed me that the breakfast was included. So I asked if I still had time to get it that day, and she said yes and that it was included. And I asked again to verify that I was able to get it that day, and she said yes. Excited about my free breakfast for the day, I go to get it, and they guy tells me that I would have to pay cash up front since it wasnâ€™t included on the first day. He even called the front desk (which was literally right around the corner) and he said that they verified what he was telling me. Why tell me one thing, if you are going to immediately deny me it seconds later? 2. The first day, I called to ask how to use the heating since it was too warm in the room, and they told me that if I turn the knob all the way down that it would cool down in about 15 min or so. So even though it had been turned down all day, I did as they told me. 20-30 min later I called and told them that it did not cool down as expected. So she asked if I wanted to switch rooms (which really was the nicest thing they did for me all trip), and so she showed me a couple rooms until we found a room with cooler temperature. I slept that night, and it heated up a lot. So I called again that morning to tell them about it, and she said that the engineer would come and check it out and that it would be the right temp when I got home. When I got home, it was still hot. So I call again, and I show them the instructions on how to use the heating and according to that, the room should average at 22degC, and that you could heat/cool it plus/minus 5degC. They tell me that during the winter it is always warmer than that and that I just have to open my window. Why couldnâ€™t they have told me that the first three times I called? Plus, when they showed me the rooms, the first room they showed me was considerably bigger than the one I was in. Why wouldnâ€™t they put someone who is staying for 2 weeks in a nicer room? 3. When checking out, she asked if I wanted my phone charges on my CC, to which I asked how much and she said it was 5.50eruo, so I said ok. Then she gave me my credit card slip to sign, and it was over 18 euro. Why did she tell me the wrong information to begin with, and why wouldnâ€™t she have corrected herself before charging my card? 4. After opening my windows, the next night I get home from work and my windows were closed and the room was once again warm. So I called to ask that they not be closed, and they told me that they wouldnâ€™t close them again. The next day I get home from work and they were once again closed and it was warm. So I once again called to ask that they not close my windows. Finally, they stopped closing them. I understand that not everything can be perfect, but I felt like they just kept getting things wrong: 5. Friday night at 2am I was locked out of the hotel outside for at least 5-10min. Luckily someone was leaving that allowed me to get into the hotel because they didnâ€™t hear me pounding on the windows. When I asked them about it, they barely shrugged their shoulders and said sorry. When I called the customer service number to complain, after talking to them for about 6-7 min or so, they told me to hold and then hung up on me. I also informed the person the next morning about it, and again, itâ€™s as if they didnâ€™t care. 6. I bought the internet, and immediately upon using it, I had troubles accessing sites that I know were up (ie, cnn ...). So I had to call a service number to figure it out. 7. I asked to use their free internet in the lobby, and it couldnâ€™t access google. So I had to ask to have someone look at it. 8. They told me that they sold stamps, so I had planned on getting stamps there to mail post cards, and when I went to purchase them, they told me that they were out. 9. I asked the concierge to make a reservation for me through a tour company, and he told me that they donâ€™t do work with that company and that he wouldnâ€™t call for me. Incredulously, I asked why he wouldnâ€™t call, and his co-worker (realizing that I was annoyed) said that he would call for me. 10. After he made me the reservation, I asked him to point out where on the map I had to go. He pointed to the wrong place on the map (it was close, but wrong). Why wouldnâ€™t he say that he wasnâ€™t exactly sure where it was located, but that it is near where he pointed? Or why not look it up on the internet that was right in front of him? I know that a lot of what I said above are really small things, but it just kept building on top of each other. I especially take offense to being told wrong information with such certainty. I would much rather be told that they will look into something than to lie to my face. I hate to sound like a whiny American who expects the best customer service, but I have travelled a good amount through Europe and some parts of Asia. Also, I have stayed in a wide variety of hotels (from the cheapest hostels to much nicer hotels), and this is by far the most frustrating experience I have ever had. In terms of good things about the hotel, the facilities were clean and new. The shower was nice. The breakfast was good. It is in a great location (close to a lot of action, but removed enough that I could thankfully sleep with the windows open without any noise). They seem to have at least a couple larger rooms (although mine was tiny). I think that is about it for the good.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but Nice Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: ayz75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in January 2009 with our dog! Hotel room was very modern and clean but really small though. However the wooden floor makes up for it, much nicer than the carpeted rooms in most hotels! Location was pretty good, close to the Van Gogh museum and the PC Hoofstraat (nice shopping area) Tram stops are just in front, very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and some bad!”
Reviews.Author: jembabe100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the NH Amsterdam Centre hotel for one night in October 2008. We booked the hotel through hotels.nl and paid 135 euros for a standard room. We booked the hotels through a special deal where we were allocated one of the four NH hotels in central Amsterdam. I named two hotels that we could have preferred to stay in which were much more central than the Amsterdam Centre but were allocated this hotel (I did call the company and asked to be changed but this was not possible). All in all the hotel was very luxurious and certainly worth a 5 star rating. Our room was very clean and came with many extras such as slippers, bath robe and a choice of pillows. I had requested a king or queen size bed but ended up with two single beds pushed together-I came falling down the middle during the night! We had a lovely shower although our original booking information said that we would also have a bath. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel as it was very expensive (25 euro pp for breakfast!), however, I guess you would expect this from a 5 star hotel. I also heard someone complaining that they had to pay to use the hotel's gym facilities-this person was under the impression that the website indicated that this was included. So...despite some problems, my partner and I had a very enjoyable trip. To anyone visiting the hotel, we would strongly recommend a visit the BOLS museam around the corner (opposite the Van Gogh museum)-it's 10 euros to visit but for that price you get a cocktail of your choice included and numerous samples of the various liquors-we left quite drunk!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorate hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: StaroKuwait
Reviews.Content: I have stayes for one week in this loveley hotel in mid August. It was my second visit to this hotel, first when we arrived we were assigned to room 546 on the back of the hotel it was nice but small, later in the day we have noticed a noice commening from the radiator and since it was sunday and no maintenance ppl available we have been moved to another room 519 which is located on the corner facing mariott hotel. It was a bit noisey during the day but we had a good sleep in the night. NH hotel it is time to change the bed mattress it is too old and i had back bain every morning. the location of the hotel in leidsplain is excellent for cafes and resturante. The hotel staff are freindly and helpful. If I go back to amsterdam definitly I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good times in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tracylh5791
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the Leidseplein area next to the Marriott. It's about a 15 minute walk up to Central Station / Dam square and the Red light District areas, but this is no problem as Amsterdam is beautiful and the best way to see the city is by walking through it. We booked a 99 euro per night (double room) deal with hotels.nl but please be careful to check that they have sent your reservation to the hotel as we arrived and they had no record of us. Luckily they weren't full and honoured the reservation and the girl on reception was extremely helpfull and very polite. All the staff here are extremely pleasant and make you feel very welcome, from the bar staff to the concierge. The hotel will look after your luggage when you check out if required for free, call you taxis and help you with anything really. Also on a Sunday check out is 5pm not the usual 12pm. The rooms are not massive but ample size. The bathroom is clean and modern with a hairdryer, towels and some lovely toiletries (yes i took some home with me - well they are complimentary!) so dont panic if you've forgotten your razor or toothbrush and paste (as we had), its there for you. The beds are so comfy and they will even let you see a few differnent pillows before choosing which one you like! There is an iron and board, tea / coffee making facilities and a mini bar (payable).
