Slippers are provided too. We had a room facing the main road, noisy when open, but quiet when closed and the room was air conditioned. All in all, this was a lovely place to stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: FeritCiva
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want to be close to Leidseplein & Holland Casino. Although the bathroom is a bit small, the room is spacious enough (we had a twin room) and really clean. The beds are comfortable. Check-in & especially front desk staff is very helpful. I don't know about the breakfast or other meals - because this is Leidseplein! Once you get out of the hotel, you find all the world's cousine in front of your eyes. We had a really great rate from a Netherlands based website, so this doubled the worth of this NH experience. Recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowana
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1pm to reception and I had booked 3 twin rooms. All the rooms were ready and the reception staff were all really friendly and helpful. The foyer is clean bright and modern with a bar. The rooms were all clean modern and had all the usual 4* expectations. All the rooms I saw were small but perfect for a two day stay in Amsterdam. The hotel is located right across from the leidsplien and close to all the cafe's and bars. We did not have breakfast but right across the street is a breakfast place for a lot less than the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T!”
Reviews.Author: Halldecker
Reviews.Content: I became far too aware of the bathroom noises of the guest in the room atop mine. Every-one-of-them! I assume the room below me kept track of mine. I heard every door on my floor (perhaps others, the noise was non-stop) shut, slam shut. BANG BANG BANG. Non-stop. Mattresses (I was given a room with two single beds crammed together) were soft and lumpy, way past their useful lives. Service at the desk was lacking, a 12 minute wait was explained "we never know how many guests will need assistance at any time." Obviously; and more than they'd planned for. I've stayed at NH Hotels world-wide; this is the first time I've ever encountered this level of noise and service. I don't know was more disgusting, the BANG BANG BANG or the noises from the guest upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to business travelers. The hotel was clean, comfortable and had nice amenities (breakfast, internet, iron/ironing board and apples at the front desk...). The rooms were bright, clean and modern. Everything you would expect from a quality hotel any where in the world. And that is the only "problem" with the hotel is that it lacks character. The location was ideal, the front desk personnel were wonderful and helpful. It was an easy walk to Vondel Park and Leidseplein. The No. 1 Tram stops right out front and all the other trams are only a short walk away in Leidseplein. I would recommend this hotel. On another note, we originally had reservations at another hotel in which we were dissatisfied. We walked in the NH hotel on the first evening. The NH had rooms available at a very reasonable price and they allowed us to see a room that evening. We moved the next morning and we were very satisfied with the room and service. If you stay here and breakfast is not included in your room price, be sure to ask for the price. There are places to eat breakfast in Leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: busygirlla
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with my friend for a weekend for the Cannabis Cup festival. This hotel is very modern looking, very boutiquey... I thought that the hotel was great, big rooms compared to the Marriott because we accidentally checked in to the Marriott which was next to it by mistake, and the room at the Marriott was a lot smalled than the room at the NH and the Marriott was nothing special. The location is okay, you have to walk a little to get to the center of the town, but I recommend this hotel. I didn't eat at their restaurant so I can't say much about that.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great experience at the NH”
Reviews.Author: abitagirl
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the NH last week. We loved the location, you can walk to just about everything and if something was too far to walk, the tram is just across the street. We booked through a package with airline and hotel through KLM.When we first checked in we were assigned to a room in the back building. We didn't like it at all, it was small and had no view. We went back to the desk and asked for something better. We were able to upgrade but had to pay 25 euros per night. We went to check out the upgraded room and it was radically different from the first. We happily spent the extra money. The room was in the front of the hotel (room 707) and had three huge windows overlooking the Leidesplein Square (with great blackout curtains! we slept so late every day). The bathroom was really nice, with a deep sunken marble tub. The toiletries were really nice too. We had a King size bed that was pretty comfortable (mattress was kind of soft) and the room was nicely furnished with plenty of closet and drawer space. Our breakfast was included and was excellent. There were eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, potoato's , quiche, pancakes, fresh fruit, cereal, fresh squeezed oj and a big variety of croissants, muffins, breads, cheeses and cold cuts every day. We ordered room service a couple of times and they were great. We got our order within 15 or 20 minutes each time. The room was cleaned well and we had no complaints with housekeeping. got turn down service when we remembered to request it. You can choose from a variety of pillows and they will bring whatever you choose to your room. There was a good variety of pay per view movies for rent and several English speaking channels on the TV. All the help we met were helpful, polite and professional. There is a nice bar. We didn't eat in the restaurant. The gym was basic but you are right near Vondelpark and we ran there which was amazing. We would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: laiwwm
Reviews.Content: the hotel is renovated and the design is quite good. the location of the hotel is good. That's all and my stay left a lot of bad memory. I booked the hotel in the internet and they couldn't find my reservation. It is absolutely ridiculous for such a famous 5 stars hotel. After getting into the room, the room was full of dust on the telephone, tables and on the floor. I am very doubt about the house keeping standard. The payment was messy, I had to paid by cash again even I was debited by credit card during the booking system. Moreover, after I left the hotel for 2 weeks, they debited my credit card without any notice. I emailed to them to look for the reason. They claimed that I used 3 bottles of water at the minibar (which I never used at all). What a ridiculous! It is totally messy, overpriced and poor-serviced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireTourist25
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in Amsterdam as part of the 2008 New Year celebrations. This was our 3rd trip to Amsterdam but our first stay in this particular hotel. The NH Amsterdam Centre is a decent 3 star hotel. The Styling is contemporary and the hotel benefits from standard facilities for a hotel of this class. The rooms are confortable, if a bit small, but they are clean with well appointed bathrooms. A good shower is always a positive! The location is probably the most important feature, being just off Leidseplein and well within walking distance of most attractions. The Museum district is within 5 minutes walk, Anne Franks house within 15 minutes and the central station about 20 minutes walk. There is a tram stop right outside the hotel where you can catch the number 1,2, or 5 trams, which cover the main routes. Overall not a bad stay. Great if you want to see the best of what Amsterdam has to offer, but perhpas lacking if you are after some European character!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Sun75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week for a business visit. I discovered the hotel last year in another business visit. However, it was my first time this year (July/07), I stayed in the hotel. I was concerned about small rooms due to some comments in tripadvisor pages. Thus, I booked a bigger room due to a long stay. Big room, good bathroom. Just for your info, big rooms have no view for the main street. I was just seeing the side walls of Marriot. NH Amsterdam has an Italian restaurant inside. It is also mentioned in the city travel guides. Good, not bad. But I was expecting more in terms of food. In addition, I noticed that they mostly focus on Dutch guests and offer the locals free desserts and liquors etc. In terms of attitude, you donâ€™t feel you are really in an Italian restaurant, even if most of the waiters are from south Italy. NH Amsterdam is just next to Marriot. And Marriot has a Pizza Hut restaurant. Both Marriot and Pizza Hut have the same main enterance door. It was strange to see Pizza Hut in Marriot! I also ate there two times. Also last year. Not bad. NH is pretty near to Rijk Museum, walking distance. Good opportunity to visit. And I also visited Van Gogh Museum. It was perfect. Over all, NH Amsterdam City Center is a good hotel. In terms of location, it was between the convention center and city center.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, with Great toiletries”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Europe for our honeymoon with Amsterdam as one of our stops. I am picky when it comes to hotels and like modern over classic. Hotel was nice and room was medium in size. The bathroom was modern and the toiletries they provided were AWESOME. The most I have seen at any hotel. The hotel is located near Leidsplein Square in the south end of the city. Around 3 miles from the Amsterdam Centraal train station. Easy walking distance to museum quarter and upscale shopping district, w/ Chanel, Prada, etc. Staff was very accomodating and everyone spoke english. We would definitely return to this hotel chain. There are several "NH" hotels and they all looked very presentable, just depends on the location you want to stay in and if you dont mind walking a couple of miles. The city isn't that large and is easy to navigate. BTW - we pronounced the hotel N -H like we do in the America's but it is actually Dutch and pronounced N -HA, if you have to tell a cabbie where you are staying ahahahaha

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katy2d2
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. This was a post-night of a cruise tour package and we didn't have a choice where we stayed, but I would stay here again if I ever find myself in Amsterdam. Not sure what thet hotel normally charges, but we paid $430.00 through the travel agent, which I feel is outrageous. Breakfast was included, but restaurant didn't open until 7:00 am, and we had to leave at 7:00 for the airport, so we missed breakfast. The location was excellent (right down the street from the museums, and across the street from a square). Room was comfortable & well equipped. Bathroom was well lit (important to me) and would take an adaptor for a curling iron. The only problem (other than price) was that it was Sunday and their restaurant was not open for dinner. We were both feeling under the weather and didn't feel like venturing out that evening, but had no choice. Also, they charge for internet use, which at the rates we paid, I would expect for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for foraging into the city centre!”
Reviews.Author: elbouffant
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a wonderful Sat am to Sunday night quickie. Took a taxi from the airport at 35 euros saves all the hassle. They let us check in early but the superior room was overlooking an interior courtyard with scaffolding! A quick phone call later and we were given 2nd floor room overlooking the square which was only available later .No problem by the time we had returned our bags had been moved for us. Staff were excellent and the concierge brilliant at pointing us in the right direction. HIRE BIKES! just around the corner for 10 euros. There are great eating places around the hotel and dont miss the Bulldog coffee shop for some smoke ( 5mins way ).Although the Bulldog is touristy we loved the vibe and freindly crowd. Took the Blue Boat Canal dinner cruise opposite the hotel for a 2 hour candle lit tour. Although the meal was pre-prepared it was really good and served by freindly staff with as much booze as you could drink! The location is great for cycling into the city and park. All in all a great weekend but HIRE BIKES to save blisters!

Reviews.Title: “A fantasic stay - Would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: luce162
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for 4 nights at the beginning of September. We had a brilliant time in Amsterdam - it's a wonderful city. We tried to fit in as much as possible and it was nice to come back to such a wonderful hotel to rest those aching feet! First impressions were great - the lobby was clean and modern with small but stylish bar, lounge area, resturants etc. Check-in was quick and our bags were taken up to the room. We paid for a standard room, which as previous reviews have stated was a bit on the small side, but if you only use the room for sleeping then it's more than adequate. The room was clean and comfortable and offered dressing-gown, slippers etc. as well as tea/coffee facilities, mini-bar, safe, television (with English chnnels). The queen-size bed was extremely comfortable with choice of pillows. Could not hear any noise during the night and had really good night's sleep. Bathroom was small but well designed with large wet-room style shower area - with double shower-head. Nice toiletries and I was impresed with the fact that you could adjust the lighting in the bathroom. We didn't opt for breakfast as it seemed quite pricey . We drank in the bar one night which was expensive but we expected this. Sevice was great and atmosphere really relaxed. The area is fantastic - the front of the hotel looks out onto a canal where canal cruises (definately try an evening candle-light cruise - very romantic) and river bikes can be hired. Opposite is Leidsplein (a square with bars/restaurants and street entertainment) and the main street off of the square - Leidstraat is lined with lots of 'high street' shops. The hotel is two minutes walk from VondelPark and another few minutes from the musuem area (where the more upmarket shops are). Use trams to get around - really cheap and stops right outside the hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a retreat from a hetic day in Amsterdam. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative point I have to say is double-check your bill at the end of your stay as we were charged for a mini-bar item that we didn't have.However they removed this charge from the bill, no questions asked, apologising for their mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulista05
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location, excelent service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jeanne0373
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 days in July and were very pleased with the room, staff and breakfast. I emailed the hotel and requested a "comfortable" room with a view. I also mentioned this website and that some guests were disturbed by construction and that I wanted to avoid that. I never heard back, but when we arrived,we reiterated our request, and we had a room on the 4th floor facing the front- Our bay window opened up to a view of the street, a small park and a canal. With 2 chairs and a small table, we had a perfect spot for a late afternoon bottle of wine and some great cheese. The king sized bed was very comfortable and with AC, we were not bothered by the early morning traffic. Breakfast was included and was quite extensive. The hotel employees were extremely helpful and friendly, especially the doormen. And the location was perfect. We walked everywhere, and the Leidseplein had the best restaurants and music just a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, but very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: blondi21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, both in our mid-20's stayed in the Amsterdam Centre the first week in August. As a warning, there are many NH hotels in Amsterdam named similarly and we found ourselves at the incorrect hotel(NH City Centre) hotel at first. After seeing the unbelievably tiny rooms and feeling the heat from the broken A/C we promptly requested a transfer to the Amsterdam Centre. The hotel was well kept, clean, and the staff had an overall friendly demeaner. While we found Amsterdam extremely expensive, this hotel was no exception. We ordered a coffee and a tea for breakfast one morning, recieved them 45 minutes later and were charged 8 euro(about 10 US dollars). Needless to say, we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel again. Also overpriced was the internet usage fee- 15 euro per day. We instead opted to use free internet cafes, which were plentiful around the city. We chose to pay a 25/euro a night fee to be upgraded, and it was worth it for a larger room on the side of the hotel(away from the noise of the trams and street traffic). The bed was extremely comfortable and a variety of pillows were available upon request. The only complaint was an un-cooperative consierge, whom incorrectly informed us how to purchase a ticket for the Talis(the high-speed train to Paris). After first asking, he informed us it would be approximately 135 euro per person. He checked the prices, and said it was 250 per person. He then told us to buy internet usage to book the tickets ourselves. After we pleasantly asked him to book for us, he told us the tickets were sold out and we should go to the Central Station at once to try to get a ticket. An hour later, we arrived at Central Station to find an hour and a half wait to purchase tickets. We were very disgruntled. The next day, we inquired with another consierge. He promptly told us booking online was not possible, and he could arrange for a reservation so that we would not have to wait in the always long lines at the station. This trip for us was last minute, for we were not aware a 4 hour train ride would take us to Paris. If you have the chance, I would most definitely book this train for a wonderful trip. In general, we found Amsterdam food to consist of bread, cheese, french fries with mayo(at EVERY meal), and a fried-croquet type of dish. And of course, lots of beer. Be prepared to eat these odd dishes, or go hungry. We stopped at their grocery stores(Albert Heijn's), but could not decipher the labels on the food items. Travel around the city is primarily by bike or tram. Tram cards can be purchased at the Albert Heijn's for a lower price than on the tram itself. Be aware of the bikes, for they don't yield for anything! If you have any questions please contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: drewyzacky
Reviews.Content: Really overpriced. Basic, tiny room. View of only concrete through the window. All the furniture was chipped and shoddy. Bathroom was nice and well equipped though small. Had to wait two hours for room to be ready even though they said it would be half an hour. Room was really dusty and smelt a bit musty on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashanita
Reviews.Content: We just returned 2 days ago from a 3 nights stay in NH Amsterdam Center and i would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit Amsterdam. We booked through Otel.com for a fair price with breakfast included.the breakfast was excellent with lots of choices and the room(kind of small) was clean and the bed was really comfortable.House keeping was good.They changed the towels and sheets everyday. We have a 1 and a half year old son, and requested for a crib and it was a good one compared to so many hotels i've stayed around Europe. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite. There's a tram stop right in front of the hotel. Trams 1,2 and 5 go to and from the center. One more thing when you go to Amsterdam, do take the Free Walking Tour where you assemble in Dam Square or the in front of the Central Station.It was a really very good and informative 3 and a half hour walk.It starts at Dam Square and ends at Anne Frank's House.You just pay them at the end of the tour wahatever amount or you can just leave anytime you want.No Obligations.It was wort it tough.

Reviews.Title: “Good location beware building work means early start !!”
Reviews.Author: tizwaz
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay with our 2 children and we found the hotel clean and the staff efficient and friendly. The breakfasts are pricey at around 20 euros per person so we took a 5 minute walk down the road and ate at pancake corner where we had a continental breakfast for around 8 Euros each. The hotel is centrally placed and we found walking to all the toursit attractions no problem at all, the concierge staff helped us with directions. The room was of good size we thought but the bathroom was small but has everything you need. You are provided with a full range of toiletries. Our biggest criticism would be of the building work. Our room overlooked the back of the hotel, and our view was one of scaffolding. At around 7:45am building work started with cutting machines and workmen shouting to one another making it impossible to sleep. I am unsure how many rooms will be affected by this but a quick look out the window showed quite a few other rooms over looking the area.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Hurdial
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great service, but do not use the internet in the hotel bedroom its a waste of space and time. Use internet outside the hotel it costs a lot less than in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SCookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with a group of friends. E-mailed the hotel in advance with some specific requests and all were met. In fact when we checked in they advised that they had given us a free upgrade to a superior room. Room was large and decorated in a very modern style and bathroom great, with all usual items you would expect from a hotel of this standard. Breakfast was great, with selection of cereal, fruit, cold meat, bacon, sausage, eggs, bread and pastries etc. etc. and is served till quite late in the morning. Good if you are nursing the after effects of a night sampling the delights Amsterdam. Location is good for Museums, Vondelpark and Leidseplein, where there are loads of restaurants and bars and it was buzzing.If you are prepared to have a stroll, everything else you may want to see in the centre is easily accessible with a few minutes. Would I stay here again? Yes if I got a similar good deal including breakfast, not sure I would be so keen had I paid the standard rate, but then I always like to get a deal when booking hotels. I can see why some may say this is not a 5 star as the modern style, for me, detracts from the luxury feel of a more traditional 5 star hotel, however the staff couldn't have been more helpful and welcoming. Yes there are one or two small items like the finish of some of the cabinets in the bedroom having a few knocks on them, however these are functional environments. For me a small scuff on a piece of furniture in the room where I can very comfortably change and sleep is not going to ruin my holiday!

Reviews.Title: “5 star I don't think so”
Reviews.Author: jakkione
Reviews.Content: Listed as 5 star but i totally disagree. although i would give it a 3/4 star rating. cost a lot and room very small. I must say though it was really clean and the doorman a star showed us where we should visit and gave us a map with all the good places marked out for us. Bar man Peter was a lovely guy too. would go back I just think the star rating is wrong but Amsterdam is brilliant and this hotel was in a great location for getting trams to get around the city. Don't use cabs it is cheaper and quicker by tram even getting to the airport is a breeze as trams take you to centraal and train goes straight to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; pretty good room”
Reviews.Author: ATLgirl
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy when we arrived- because we had booked at another hotel, and had been shifted due to overbooking. The NH is not as nice a hotel as the one we got bumped from (but we did get a partial discount from hotels.com which we had booked through). The NH is very contemporary; very clean lines in the lobby, the bar, and the rooms. The bathroom was adequately sized and sparkly and clean with marble and chrome. The windows were very big and opened (always a plus). The closet space was generous (for a European hotel room), and there was plenty of surface area for suitcases, etc. The room that we had was a bit smaller than those shown on the website for this hotel. The bed was full sized rather than queen (which is fine with us) and pushed against one wall so one person has to climb over the other to get into bed. The mattress quality might not satisfy some people. The room did have a few maintenance issues: some spots of peeling paint, and a ceiling vent being held up with masking tape. But the overall effect was good, so we were happy. The location is very convenient, and the area is beautiful. I plan to return to Amsterdam and would stay at this hotel if I could get a good rate (no more than $125)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the NH”
Reviews.Author: jerseyaruba
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Classy, clean, in a great area. 10 min walk from the Dam square. Tram is just feet away. across the street from the hard rock and canal tour boats. 10-15 min from Van Gogh. Only downfall was the internet. We had issues getting online to check in for our flight. But other then that everyone there was very nice. Bellhops were great with bags, taxis, reservations. Nice hardwood floor rooms with comfy beds. I would stay here again! We paid about $140 a night on priceline. It is a 4-5 star hotel. Rooms are huge for european standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Craigmogs
Reviews.Content: On pulling up at the hotel we were geeted by the very friendly doorman who pointed out that bikes are allowed on certain parts of the pavement (good tip if you dont like broken bones). Check In was quick and staff helpful. Room was small but who stays in hoels rooms for anty long period of time. Breakfast expensive at 22 Euros but found the satalite sports bar great for breakfast at only 8.90 Euros. Great city plenty to do and some sights you will probably never see anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas break”
Reviews.Author: Celticbach
Reviews.Content: Booked through Superbreak and had 3 nights for 2 with breakfast included-exceptional value as hotel in excellent location, very clean and unfussy. staff very welcoming and happy to help. Room in front despite a nice view with mini balcony (romm 201) was small and bathroom cramped. Some rooms at back were bigger, smartly furnished. Plenty of eating options nearby. Perfect Christmas break. Get a good deal and this place is worth it. Try the canal hop on, hop off too- very good way of seeing amsterdam by day and night!

Reviews.Title: “location +”
Reviews.Author: steve62
Reviews.Content: clean contempory hotel with good location tram stops right outside the front door adjacent to Vondel Park nearby parking at 36 euros a day room was smallish w/ comfortable bed bath also compact, really only good for one person at a time breakfast available but expensive canal bus stop also across the street staff polite and helpful overall an 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Summer weekend”
Reviews.Author: ttl_17
Reviews.Content: We came and stayed here for 2 nights at the end of July we booked with Expedia, when we booked in to the hotel they offered us a room upgrade which was great. The only downside was that we didn't have a great view from the window as it just faced on to another building. Which was the only downside I could think of, but who comes on holiday to look out the window? The good points: First of all the staff was friendly and very helpful and willing to answering our questions about the local area. The room was spacious with added safe and mini bar, the shower was great and the bed was massive I had a really good night sleep after a long day of sight seeing. Not only was it in a great location near Vondelpark,Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum it was also just only down the road from all the shops and resturants too. This hotel defo added to a great weekend, if I came to Amsterdam again I would defo come and stay here : )

Reviews.Title: “definetively not worth 5*”
Reviews.Author: cocotti
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in amsterdam for 4 days as i had a special occassion coming up so i searched by trip advisor and other sites that have reviews about the hotels and then y decided to book the nh centre 5*. I booked through expedia as with klm flight and hotel was way more convenient. Once we arrived there to the front desk arround midday we had the impression as being in the supermarket trying to get a room.. first they wanted to give us a standard room when I booked and payed for a Superior. The room was ok the bathroom was clean the bed was big but there was closet with two hangers and not much space to leave our clothes. The breakfast wasn't included in our price and they wanted us to pay 19euro for a breakfast!! we had wonderful brekfast just few minutes across the street for 7 euro and was fabulous!! The location was ok near the shopping area and other attractions. We had another bad experience at the check out as we booked the "shuttle" to the airport... they charged us 25 euro for the shuttle and it wasnt a shuttle it was a old crumpy taxi after picking us up we went to pick up another two people in another nh at dam square very uncomfortable as they were quite big.. so we were very very upset regarding this matter as when we arrived we took a great taxi and payed 19 euro.. definetively a rip off... I work in the travel industry and this hotel rated 5 star do not deserve it as the services etc are not at the 5 star standard level. Recepcionist in the morning quite rude and not very helpful in the evening the staff was a bit better but not very interested in helping us with some information.. If i go back to amsterdam i will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpp17
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this place to anyone. A nice modern hotel with extremely helpful staff. We had the breakfast free for the first night and was very impressed with the selection on offer. The second night we decided against, as 24 Euros is quite pricey. but all in all, the hotel was very nice. Also the location was very good. Close to the museums, and Vondelpark practically on your doorstep. Yet trams to the station were also close by, and Dam square is easily walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler CT
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at the NH Amsterdam Centre. We had a very nice room. The location was great for everything-very easy to walk everywhere. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: citybeagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights in June 2004. It is a clean, modern hotel in a good location near the Leidseplein, within walking distance to the Vondelpark, the Museumplein, and the Heineken Experience. It's not very close to the city center, but within walking distance and it is an interesting walk. You can also catch the trams across the street. My room was tasteful and comfortable, but very tiny. NH hotels are a safe bet, but usally nothing spectacular. The rate seems quite expensive for this level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: flingwing
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this marvelous hotel for 3 nights on a recent trip to Amsterdam. Unfortunately, the NH was so popular, we couldn't extend our stay in this "lap of luxury" and had to change hotels. One of the most important aspects of this hotel is its location. Very close to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum and next to Vondelpark, it is also at the top end of a great shopping route. This allows one to walk all the way downtown along popular shopping streets. This area is also rife with good pubs and restaurants and not near the seedier downtown/red light district. As well, it is right on tram and bus routes. The rooms were very clean and modern, and I think they were large by European standards. The bathroom was very nice, probably the nicest one I've enjoyed while travelling overseas. Clean, comfortable beds and a 27" TV with at least 5 English channels in case you don't speak Dutch. We found the staff consistent with a 5 star hotel in their extremely helpful and pleasant manners. The lounge was a great place to have a nightcap before turning in. We didn't have breakfast included in the price, but understand it costs 24 euro each, a bit pricey. In a nutshell, this is a 5 star hotel that is priced fairly well. The excellent location and clean, safe and extremely comfortable surroundings give me no qualms about recommending this to anyone travelling to Amsterdam. In fact, if I every go back, this will definitely be one hotel I call on.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the breakfast charge if booking with Expedia”
Reviews.Author: mrsmaxernst
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent. The lobby is a bit unpleasant, but the rooms are quiet and neutral. There is no note of a breakfast charge, which can appear as a surprise 24Euro charge for the breakfast bar on checkout if booking with Expedia. The hotel would not remove the charge nor would Expedia. I would not stay here again, due to this issue. The neighborhood is relatively charmless, and there is no cafe nearby. I would stay in the Jordan neighborhood if I went again. The Caravaggio exhibit at the Van Gogh Museum is divine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: ShanaAFolk
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right along tram routes and an easy walk to the Rijksmuseam/Van Gogh. Many great restaurants in walking distance. The room was nice - clean, modern and comfortable. But for the price we paid, I expected more. Our keycard to open the room door continuously de-magnetized, so we were constantly having to return to the front desk for assistance - no matter where we kept the card (ie far away from our credit cards, magnets, anything to demagnetize) it continued. The shower sprayed water all over the floor and the water pipes "groaned" all night. The front desk was less than helpful (when we called from the airport to ask what they recommend as the best way to the hotel, they answered, "we don't know"), but the consierge was helpful with train information.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort if not character”
Reviews.Author: PurseyHandbag
Reviews.Content: A modern bulding, fairly recently refitted inside, with dark laminate flooring in the bedrooms and lots of minimalist beige fabric and sticks in vases everywhere. Initially slightly disappointed as we were paying a lot and our room wasn't huge (though it did have a sofa at the end of the bed for watching the telly) but the comfort and ease of everything soon grew on me. The room overlooked a busy road and the canal and up to the hectic Leidesplen with huge (totally sound-proof) windows, but the floor to ceiling curtains blocked out every scrap of light, so it was like waking up in a cosy cocoon. The bed was blissfully comfy, and the room on a chilly April weekend was just the right temperature. Our Dial-a-flight booking included buffet breakfast (otherwise offered at a 'special rate' of 17.50 euros) and it was fabulous. We ate bacon, eggs, sausages, every bakery product you could think of, fruit (prepared, dried or whole), cereals, yoghurts, cheese, meats, fish, salad, pasta, fried potatoes, delicious juices, coffee, tea etc, even fizz (you can tell I like my food) and at the weekend you can eat til noon. Hurrah! Easy walking distance from everything, tram stops nearby etc. So in summary - next time I personally would rather stay in somewhere more unusual for my money eg a houseboat or something grand and old like the Pulitzer. But we definitely had a lovely time at the nh. There are other nh hotels around which looked nicer too - the Doeren (?) being one.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: CBMK
Reviews.Content: Expected more from this hotel for the price. Location near the Leidesplein and museums was good. Was right beside the Vondelpark. Really thought that park would have some flowers in it during the spring. was disappointed with it. back to the hotel, couldn't believe the price we paid didn't include breakfast which was â‚¬24 a head. Room was nice, I liked the furniture but it wasn't that spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonymousfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the weekend and then for a couple of days on business. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable . The location is great, nice to be away from the hussle and bussle of the Dam Square area making the stay much more relaxing. The transport links around the hotel are good and its near all the main museums. Service was friendly and helpful. I would recommend for both a weekend stay and for the business traveller

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a weekend away!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH Centre Hotel fri 3rd feb - mon 6th feb for my friends birthday. i booked it on expedia and got a good deal. The hotel upon arrival i wouldn't have said it was 5 star more 4 but anyway it is nice and modern. we checked in with only one quibble they wouldn't take my visa debit card for a deposit for extra's so i had to leave 100 euro which was a bit anoying! they offered us breakfast upon checking in - i think it's usually 25 euro each and the gave us it for 17. we took it and it was nice although a bit expensive for a buffet!! but in saying that we had a bout 5 courses each and didn't leave until we were stuffed, so it's kinda worth it as it sets u up for the day ahead!! the fresh croissants are well nice!! i did also ask for an upgrade when i booked as it was a special birthday and they did, and the girl at the desk just said u booked a standard room and gave me a cheeky wink!! so i was made up with that!! the room was spacious with a massive bed, sofa, safe, and a good range of satalite channels. the bathroom was also nice - good shower and a big bath. they gave us bathrobes and slippers and lots of little extras which is nice, like toothbrushes, razors etc, even a birthday card for my friend!!! we had a view of the side street but i wasn't complaining as the room was great. the mini bar is expensive but handy for an emergency bottle of water or a coke etc!! the hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is about 10-15 mins walk away from the red light district and central station etc, but it's a pleasant walk up through the main shopping street or u can just jump on a tram which only takes a few minutes but i preffered to walk. the shopping is great, lots of little one off shops and shoe shops. we visited Maddam Taussards which was fun and also took a canal boat trip which left from just opposite the hotel i think it was 10 euro each but it was good - a little long but u have got to go on the canal. be prepared to bring back a few extra pounds on your hips as the cake shops etc are brill, all i did was eat all weekend - it was all worth it tho!!we visited an irish bar just off dam square, along from maddam Taussards which was good, we went in 3 times over the weekend and it was always busy, the food was good also. the Grasshopper bar which is just over from central station is great also but a little pricey!! all in all we really enjoyed Amsterdam, the hotel was spot on, the shopping was great and the bars and restarants were fab!! u should defo go, i cant wait to go back and i'd defo stay at this hotel again, no bother!! there are some reviews complaining about having to pay for the gym and sauna etc but we were going away for a weekend so the last thing on my mind was the gym!!! we got enough excerise by walking around everywhere and seeing the lovely sites of Dam!! so dont be put off by bad reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: an_nie444443
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Really stylish rooms and we had a great view over the City (great for seeing some of the fireworks on NYE). The location is perfect, really close to excellent restaurants and bars in the Leidseplein (not sure what direction the traveller who said you had to walk aways to these amenities was going!!). There's even an Indonesian restaurant next door and if you're desperate a Pizza Hut a couple of doors down! The Vondelpark is just behind the hotel and is a beautiful place, even in winter. The main museums (Rijks and Van Gogh) are just a 5 minute walk away. There's even a Canal boat tour just opposite the hotel. We got a great rate on Expedia and would definitely stay there again and we're Amsterdam veterans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Nice size rooms, but no tub. Tubs upon request. Pleasant staff and very helpful. For the price you can't beat the location. They do not have a pool or hottub. You must pay to us the fitness center facilities. E-mailed ahead for non-smoking room and upgrade. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its all good”
Reviews.Author: thesujman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December 2005. We paid about Â£85 per night and it wasnâ€™t too bad. Room was on the small side (got the room on an allocation on arrival deal) but the quality was excellent. They also honoured our request for a non smoking room. Our room was a small rectangular shape, ok for a very short stay but would have been too cramped for anything longer. Bed was queen size, small but firm and comfortable. Shower / bathroom was spacious and excellent! Location of this Hotel was excellent, Leidseplein area of Amsterdam. Plenty of trams heading in different directions and taxi ranks minutes away from the hotel. Also nearby a large casino complex and close to the famous museums and Vondel Park. Donâ€™t be put off by people who say its far from the Red Light District, Dam Sqaure or Centraal Station. Trams are quick and easy when you have luggage and everything is a pleasant walk away at other times. We spent hours browsing through the myriad of side streets of Amsterdam. Only thing that annoyed me with this hotel was the website gave the impression gym facilities are free (a main reason for choosing this hotel and not any other) but you have to pay EURO12.50 per person per item per day. i.e. If you wanted to use the gym and then go for a sauna, price would be EURO25.00! Complained by email and got a complimentary upgrade and breakfast should I chose to stay at a NH hotel next time. However, without complementary gym usage, I doubt I would use it. No complimentary internet access either, have to pay a good EURO10+ for a 15 min ticket for the lobby computer. I used the in room TV internet facility for about EURO12.50 for unlimited access for 24hrs, which might be a better option for some. Although I was reasonably happy with this hotel (if the gym thing was free, I would have been very happy with this hotel) and now that I feel I donâ€™t need to pay a premium for location (stay anywhere nice and walk / tram it to where ever you want to go), next time, Iâ€™ll pick an equally good hotel but in a different, less obvious location and hopefully pay a lot less!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but not my favorite location”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and great hotel. But, you will need the tram if your not into walking, and unlike some of the other hotels I have stayed at in Amsterdam (like the sister hotel, the NH-City Center Hotel) you must walk a ways to find food and drink. Rooms were awesome and should meet anyones standards, and the FedEx Kinkos is nearby for business travelers. I was happy I stayed here, but prefer the location of the other NH hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room which was classy and had everything you might expect from a hotel. There are ice machines in the corridor and the staff are pleasant (except the barmaid who gave our twiglets to her friend!). We didn't eat at the hotel because all the restaurants/bars are within walkable distance - also good location if you are visiting Museums. Quite far from the Redlight district % Station but that means the hotel was quiet in the evening. One downside was the mosquitos that harrassed my boyfriend (but didn't bite me!) which is unusual in November...

Reviews.Title: “NH Serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband stopped in Amsterdam at the beginning of a 2 week vacation to Europe. We stayed 3 nights at the NH Sept.15-18th. It definitely looks nicer in the pictures but overall it was perfectly suitable. Large room, comfortable bed, seating area, clean and modern. We loved the location because you could step out of the hotel and be in the action or walk to museums. The staff was efficient, not overly friendly or unfriendly. I think it was great for a short stay and is comfortable enough. Nothing to rave about but fine.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: andreadmb
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some negative reviews- we felt this hotel was great and met our needs perfectly. Being a married couple in our 20s, we haven't stayed in many "5 star hotels" and we felt it was very nice! It was close to tram routes, a quick walk to Leidseplein, museums and Vondelpark and in a well lit, safe area. Our room was comfortable and clean. The decor was very simple with clean lines, a modern feel. The only downfall was the view, our room was on an inside circle so we saw several buildings and no view of a park or a street. If you can, request a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Karma76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Amsterdam Centre for 5 nights in August 2005. We got caught in the British Airways strike at Heathrow the second week of August and our flight was cancelled so we had to take the train to Amsterdam. We got there 36 hours after we'd left home, and the NH Amsterdam Centre couldn't have been a more welcome sight! We called in advance to say we'd be late because we were taking the train. We paid for a Best Available Room, but the room they gave us was quite nice and large. I'd say it was the same size as a hotel room in the US. I've stayed in other hotel rooms in Europe and this was by far the largest (although I'm not sure if they're all this large). The room had dark hardwood floors, a king size bed, and a couch at the foot of the bed. We got a corner room overlooking the street and we could see in three directions and over to Leidseplein. (The crosswalk was a little annoying at night and in the morning because it makes a clicking sound.) For the most part, the staff were very friendly and nice. The concierges were very helpful in helping us try to locate our luggage (which didn't arrive until 6 days later on the day we left!). The room cleaning was a little spotty. They'd clean certain things or not leave us certain things. It was a little strange, but nothing that couldn't be solved quickly by calling the front desk. The location was excellent--very close to the museums, restaurants, and shopping. The tram is a two minute walk away and you can get anywhere that way. Leidseplein is very happening at night, if you enjoy that. All in all, we loved our stay at the NH Amsterdam Centre and we'd definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sadmat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel from the 20th -24th of July. The location is great and the staff were very friendly. Our rooms were a little small with very little storage space, but the decor is lovely and modern. The restaurant attached to the Hotel 'BICE' was beautiful and the food was amazing. The only small thing I found annoying was that you have to pay for the use of the leisure facilities in the hotel, (which was not stated on the confirmation booking we received) and not something I would expect from a 5* hotel. The leisure center was also very expensive. Also we found that the sauna and steam room were not turned on during the day unless they were busy and on a couple of occasions we arrived down in the morning about 11.00am to find the sauna was like an ice box.... We ended up ringing down about a half an hour before we wanted to use it to make sure it was on. Other than that we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel in June'05. It is very well-located, on the outer edge of the central rings of canals. Since we arrived by car on the day of the train strike, traffic was hideous and I was glad we weren't having to work our way further into the center. It's near the museums and there's a canalboat stop right across the street.; I found it an easy walk from here to anything I wanted to see. The hotel has a very "Danish modern" or Asian feel to it, with sleek, clean lines - not at all what it looks like from the exterior. I wasn't in the room much, but it was gorgeous - very spacious, with a sofa across the foot of the bed facing the desk/TV on the opposite wall. Lots of closet space, and a beautiful bath. The bed was comfortable and it was quiet. I didn't eat at the hotel, but there's a very good Indonesian restaurant right next door. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Everything About It!”
Reviews.Author: legalwing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7/12-7/15 2005 and detested it, on every level. First of all, don't be deceived by its photos; its actually on the far outskirts of where you are likely to go AND it is a very plain, shabby, non-descript looking small building. The staff could not have been less friendly or helpful - whether they don't like Americans or people in generall, I dont' know. Worse, the entire hotel is blah. The rooms have no color whatsoever, and the lobby area could be in a high school cafeteria. The gym, which was implied to be free on-line, is $11.50 Euro a day! The housekeepers only clean around your stuff without moving or tidying AT ALL, and while clean, the rooms never felt fresh - I felt like I was staying in a youth hostel for adults. I've been to Europe a dozen times and this is, hands down, the worst place I ever stayed. To the extent you can usually take bad lodging into stride when you are having a great time, I hated having to return to the gloom and doom of this place every night. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In spite of some of the negative reviews, we have absolutely loved out stay at the Amsterdam Centre. It is, most definitely a 5 star hotel, not 4 as mentioned below. Our room was ver spacious, and clean. They have finished all the refurbishment activities, and the place looks beautiful. All the staff have been extremely nice and helpful in meeting our requests. It's hard to come across a hotel that's just overall excellent. This is one, and I would definitely go here again, anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rpiercef
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior room and upon our late arrival (we had phoned hours earlier to make sure they kept our room) were told that no Superior rooms were available. When we complained about this, they bought us a drink in the bar and asked for a little time to see if they could find one. Just as we'd finished our drinks they said our room was ready. The room was quite nice, facing the park across the street. But the more I thought about it, I thought, this isn't the Superior room. So the next day I asked if it was and they said no and lowered my rate. That was unnecessarily sneaky and dishonest. If I hadn't brought it up, they would have charged me for a Superior room, so be mindful of this if you stay here. That said, the hotel was otherwise quite nice. Very clean, updated, and the location was just perfect. We really loved Amsterdam and we'd stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Maximum 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aj100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH for two nights in June 2005. First of all it is not a four star hotel by any means and definatley not 5. The Rooms ar spacious for Europe but be prepared to to be awakened constantly with banging doors. The guest room doors do not have stoppers on them and I was Jolted out of bed on numerous occasions with thunderous bangs. The floors are not wood as mentioned in previous reviews. They are a cheap plastic veneer that is cold and noisy.If you put a Do not disturb sign on your door, instead of knocking on your door they call you to see if you want maid service, waking you up regardless.--unacceptable. Service is overall average.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to get over first experience”
Reviews.Author: travelotta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in April, 2005. I had booked us a superior/deluxe room (above the 'standard room' rate) because it had a small sitting area and more space. When we arrived, I was all excited and gave them my name and comfirmed a superior room, et. al. Our room wasn't ready, so we went for a walk. When we came back, we got our room and it was the smallest room I'd seen outside of a tourist class hotel in Japan. There was a one chair, but hardly room for your knees to sit in it. As tired and weary as we were, we decided to shower. Afterwards, I had my partner go downstairs to complain. He told them if this is a superior room, he'd hate to see your standard room. At which time they admitted it was a standard room. I was so mad. He then went and looked at all the rooms available and choose the best one. It was very lovely with dark wood floors, plenty of seating and room to walk around. It must have been a junior suite as I was able to see other rooms when the maids were cleaning and none were as big as ours. The view was of the back side of the hotel and another building (design house I think). From that point on, my view of the hotel was better, although I still find it hard to get over the initial room experience. I also feel they tried to pull the wool over our eyes like suckers. This hotel is really nice, but just make sure that you get the room you booked. I will not stay here again, but that doesn't mean that you shouldn't. BTW, the older bellman is a wonderful man who I believe has been there for years. Be sure and tip him well. I am rating nuetral because of my experience. Had that not happened, I'd likely have given 4

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value and good location!”
Reviews.Author: biscotti
Reviews.Content: We finally decided to choose NH Amsterdam Centre for our hotel during our visit from 18 to 20 April and were happy to find out that our rooms are quite spacious, clean and well-maintained. We agree with other reviewers that said the wooden floor, comfy beds and the coffee maker give added value to the hotel! Bathrooms are modern and clean. The view from our rooms were not that spectacular as a tall office building stood next to our hotel and unfortunately blocked the view from our rooms. Concierge and bellboys were friendly and helpful. Location is good, public transports are abundant. Closed to restaurants, cafes and pancake house (good for breakfast if you prefer to eat outside the hotel). Need to walk for approx 15-20 minutes to reach the crowded shopping streets closed to NH Krasnapolsky and the nearby shopping centres (tram is another option if you know the direction etc). The Vondel Park is very closed to the hotel and 5-10 min walk can go to PC Hooftstraat and the street is well known for many shops selling famous branded things. Guided tours can be booked instantly through the hotel. One thing to remember when you walk in Amsterdam, beware of the cyclists!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortably Balanced,Historic Hotel in a Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: insider
Reviews.Content: Such a comfortable, pleasing hotel choice ! I so enjoyed so many aspects of the hotel stay , that I'll have to forgive the negatives. I think we had the nicest room, thank you sincerely to the brilliantly helpful reservation staff. The architecture of the room, bathroom, and use of the 1920s YMCA building is uniquely superb. We enjoyed lingering over breakfast, watching Amsterdam life pass by , from the glass enclosed breakfast dining room. The hotel location was magical. We got to enjoy a different aspect of the city from each way we chose to walk from the front door of the hotel. The strange mix of personal service at the hotel is baffeling. The warm and friendly doorman on arrival and departure brilliantly knew how to make us feel at home. The concierge and check in person on Thanksgiving morning were both extremely helpful, knowledgeable and sincere. The housekeeping and engineering staff were always efficient and anxious to please. A few of the "front of house" personel, however, were arrogant and disregarding. I hate to say this because I truly enjoyed the stay. The sleek interior elements of the hotel made all of the other top level hotels seem stodgy.The NH Amsterdam Center Hotel was the best vantage point for viewing this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location, comfort and quality at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is excellent---right near Leidesplein, a trendy cultural hub full of great restaurants, cafes and within walking distance of the museums. The hotel itself was very clean, comfortable and the staff were very friendly. Yes, the hotel was undergoing some renovations at the time, but it did not interfere with our stay. Room service was quick and the food tasty. The rooms are decorated very nicely--hardwood floors and off-white duvet covers. The shower was the best shower I've seen in a hotel. Overall, it was a great experience and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: NeilMacUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, had a really nice room very comfortable. If you dont mind paying their prices and are happy to be slightly out of the centre then I dont think you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Julia99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is undergoing refurbishment. I would not recommend staying there until this is complete. Our room was very small. The air conditioning was pathetic. We ended up sleeping with the window open one night as it was so hot (it was only spring, not sure why the room was so hot). The room was very noisy - we were on the first floor (i.e. one above the ground floor) and there was a taxi rank outside our window. The night we had to sleep with the window open we were kept awake by the taxi drivers chatting very loudly. Also there were a few other more minor problems with the room, which was surprisng given the rooms have been refurbished recently - e.g. the light switch for the bathroom didn't work properly (you had to fiddle with it to get it to work) and the volume control for the tv to be heard in the bathroom was broken. Also the lift was broken while we were there but, being on the first floor, this didn't cause us too much of a problem The plus points about this hotel are its central location and friendly staff. We had breakfast in the restaurant on the first morning. It was delicious but, at Eur 22 each, expensive. I can't understand the good reviews for this hotel and am baffled at the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend staying at the NH Amsterdam and have to say i was disappointed with the hotel. I chose this hotel having reviewed all AMsterdam hotels reviewed on this site so was more than a little surprised! Like the previous review stated, I wasnt told that the hotel was still undergoing renovation and having been dropped outside the 'entrance' of the hotel by the taxi we then had to find the unmarked entrance around the corner, struggling with 2 large bags only to find that there was no doorman or anyone around to help us and one only turned up as we were struggling up the stairs with our bags - not what one would expect from a 5 star hotel. The room was particularly small and despite being told we had a 'good view' it wasnt that good! The main lifts were not working at the time of our stay and the one lift that did work took an eternity to ever show up. I would like to point out that there is no bar just a restaurant and at no time, other than breakfast, did i see anyone dine in it. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel and something tells me it was a wise move! One evening we had a reservation at Jamie Olivers 15 restaurant and when the taxi driver didnt know where it was I ran back into the hotel and the front desk staff had no idea where it was either which i found astonishing and they made little effort in helping us get directions. We were on a really tight deadline so in the end gave up of making it to the restaurant on time and back for an evening boat trip planned later. We asked that they call the restaurant on our behalf and cancel our reservation but they couldnt because the number of the restaurant was a '0900 number' which apparently they cant call from their phones - it was extraordinary and most unsatisfactory. Having stayed in many 5 star hotels I can honestly say this is more of a 3*/4* hotel and wouldnt stay at this hotel again and whilst I didnt check out any other hotels in Amsterdam I am sure for the money you could do better. The hotel is well situated by the Leidesplein which is a great buzzy safe area close to all the trams. Amsterdam is a great city and the experience at the hotel didnt spoil our trip but some advice.......go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Under refurbishment !!!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceS
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in the NH Amsterdam Centre. Overall the hotel was fine, although I'd class it as a 4 star rather than 5 star. Check in was a bit of a pain. We specifically asked for an early check in prior to our departure and we had to come back twice as our room was not ready until nearly half past four. I wasn't aware that there were renovations going on in the hotel and had to use the side door to get in. There was no lounge/bar area- just a restaurant, reception and our room. The rooms were nice and modern, and the bed was huge but I didnt expect 2 thin SINGLE duvet covers on a King sized bed from a 5 star hotel - and it was far from the most comfortable bed I have slept on. Also there was no dressing table. Bathroom was nicely done but on the smaill side. On the plus side the mini bar was well stocked and the doorman who helped us to our car on our depature was very friendly. We paid nearly Â£120 per night and felt that our expectation were not met. I have stayed in lots of cheaper hotels that have been of a better standard. Maybe when all of the renovations are finished it would be worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: ridgebackfan
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel 5 stars for great value and stylish comfort. I love the wood floors. As others have mentioned, the showers are great. Breakfast from room service was very nice. Good location. Clean rooms. Nice amenities. I've stayed here 3 times now on business and will return soon. Room renovations have been entirely completed and are well-done. At my most recent visit in February they were still working on the lobby. I expect that will be complete very soon. A new addition was the installation of wireless internet in all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A class of its own”
Reviews.Author: helenCountyDurhamUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned 27/03/2005 from the nh amsterdam centre. Booked the flight and accommodation through expedia and got a great rate with booking late.This hotel is superb!! Good location in the leidesplein area around 15 mins walk to dam square or 5 mins by tram. Arrived there on 24/03/2005. Check in was very efficient and detail to personal service was excellent. The rooms are a very contemporary design, high standard, our room was on the small side but lets face it you dont stay in there all day, too much to see in amsterdam. Toiletries, coffee facilities were replenished daily, ( mini bar wasnt cheap but handy!) and the shower is fab .We were offered discounted breakfast throughout our stay approx 8 euros per person cheaper than usual. The buffet was extensive and of very high quallity to suit everyones taste. Refurbishment to the main reception /entrance is ongoing but were were not affected by any disruption due to the location of our room. The food was excellent from the restaraunt, we ordered several meals via room service ( small fee for this 3 euros). You could order anything you wanted, if it wasnt on the menu they would still do their best to get it for you. The price of the food was often cheaper than eating in the commercial areas in town and better quality ( lasagne is fab!!!) The staff were excellent , services were exceptional . The staff made sure you had transport arranged etc for your departure. Anyone thinking this hotel wasnt five star must have been in too many of the famous coffeeshops in amsterdam. Would definitely go back . Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we travelled 1st week of march 2005 we stayed fri and sat night paid 80euro room was a little small but very clean, nice. hotel was very nice but nothing fancy. Very clean place, helpful friendly staff, great location- 5 minute tram to almost anywhere. couldnt be happier. we stayed BW EDEN on thurs and it was 59euro but fri was 120euro we looked at a few places that were far less quality and similar price

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dtravels2
Reviews.Content: (hello all, first - this is a critique of the hotel one stayed at, not the critique of other reviewers... ty) i stayed at the NH Amsterdam Center, Holland. what a great place to stay at - friendly, helpful staff. the doorman, marcel, was wonderful - truly a sweet and helpful gent. this holds true for all the staff at the NH. the hotel was clean, tranquil, a nice restaurant., and located in a great spot in amsterdam. a wonderful trip!!! i would definitely stay again at the NH Hotel. if one would like a great experience in amsterdam, the netherlands - and need an enjoyable place to stay, i'd rec. the NH Amsterdam Center.

Reviews.Title: “NH Amsterdam is Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ten of us just returned from this grand hotel. I cannot say enough good things about our stay there...Everyone we came in contact with was helpful and went out of their way to be accomodating. Our breakfast each morning was wonderful and the various selections offered "something for each of us." It is located close to the tram which takes you all over Amsterdam and to Central Station for excursions outside Amsterdam, as well as being close to great shopping, great pubs etc.. I would higly recommend this hotel for its quality and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5*....”
Reviews.Author: samaggarwal
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just returned from 3 nights in amsterdam for which we got a good deal on lastminute (which is why i booked a 5 star, normally we book 4 stars)....the NH amsterdam centre is a good hotel and would have received 4/5 instead of 3/5 had they categorised it as a 4 star and not 5 star....the hotel is comfortable but definitely definitely not 5 star!!....the rooms are clean and nice but extremely small....we've stayed at better 4 stars in budapest and barcelona so it shouldn't be the "european hotel" problem... the location is good but a cab to the central station costs not less than 12-15 Euros....there is an aiport shuttle that comes to the hotel running every 30 minutes which is probably the most convenient way to and from the airport...trams are convenient from the hotel.... ......and why would NH have 2 hotels in the same city named "NH Amsterdam Centre" and "NH Amsterdam City Centre"....this causes a lot of confusion for travellers and even locals (cabbies etc)....in fact, i think the last reviewer has understandably got confused and posted a review for the NH Amsterdam City Centre which is not this hotel.... we would probably not return to this hotel and instead try something closer to Dam Square....maybe NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky which actually looks like a 5 star (at least from the outside!)... enjoy your trip... sameer aggarwal

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: grand dutchess
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Amsterdam the NH Amsterdam Centre was everything and more. The location was excellent. It's only a ten minute walk to the tram on the Leidesplein which gives you access to the entire city. The Van Gogh Museum and Rjiksmuseum are within walking distance as are numerous shops. The rooms at the hotel were very modern and roomy. The beds were very comfortable and you had a choice of pillows. The water pressure in the shower was great. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The conceirge staff especially Ayman, Eddy, and Duncan went out of their way to answer all of our questions and offer suggestions on dining and excursions. The doorman Marcel was very helpful with giving us the daily weather report. The breakfast at the hotel was unbelievable. They had fresh baked breads and rolls, pastries, croissants, cereals, fruit, yogurt, meats, cheese, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, bacon, sausages, juices, tea and coffee. The food in Amsterdam was great. Some restaurant suggestions near the hotel are De Prins and De Klos. Prices were reasonable (given the Euro) and portions were very good. The trains are very easy to use out of Central Station. The towns of Delft and Dam Hague were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the blackout curtains which shut out the morning sunshine after late nights enjoying the best Amsterdam has to offer. The room was lovely and contemporary- with speakers in the bathroom, which was an extra treat! The only thing was the couple we travelled with didn't get such a large room. The best thing to do is contact the hotel beforehand and request a room in the NEW part of the hotel (the hotel was extended at some point). Obviously the restrictions of the older building meant smaller rooms. The location is fab, walking distance from everywhere worth going. The point about the taxi to the airport from the other reviewer may be true, but I don't think that is anything to do with the hotel- its the same wherever you go, there are dodgy taxi drivers. If you don't want to pay the large fare to the airport, get a train from Central station. In summery- the best hotel I have stayed in in Amsterdam- definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: charliechunk
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Amsterdam, and we had a fantastic trip. The NH City Centre Hotel was really nice. The decor was lovely, very modern and clean and had lovely wooden floors. Normally these kinds of hotels are not my cup of tea because I prefer places with character, but I can honestly say I really enjoyed my time there. The only complaint I have is that the rooms were a little bit cold. It was totally freezing in Amsterdam so it would have been nice to come back to a toasty room. Apart from that, I cant fault it. The hotel was in the most excellent location - only about two mins walk from Dam Square and about a ten min walk to the Red Light District. We are definatly going to go back to Amsterdam, but this time in the Summer when hopefully its not so bloody cold!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: annh53182
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough nice things about this hotel. Even though it is currently under construction, it was still one of the best hotels I have every stayed at. The rooms were comfortable and modern, the bathrooms were fantastic with excellent water pressure. I can't say enough nice things about the staff - friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, accommodating, etc. Breakfast buffet also over and above my expectations! Location was great, just a few blocks from the museums and Vondelpark plus Leidesplein where you can catch a tram to anywhere else in the city! I would stay here again in a second, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Bang for Buck in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IAD777
Reviews.Content: Didn't mean that literally. Location is unbeatable, all the charm and elegance of Amsterdam, without the seedy part. Rates are reasonable. Hotel is very modern, which can feel a bit cold, but location and price make it a top contender.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just went to Amsterdam in December, and we stayed at the NH Amerstdam Centre. I was very impressed. Although the rooms were smaller, they were very nice and cozy. The bathroom was very nice, and the water pressure in the shower was great. Loved having windows you could open. Great location, a three minute walk to the Bulldog Coffee Shop in Leidesplein. Mini-bar, although a little expensive, was VERY useful. Everyone was extremely helpful. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find fault - annoyingly!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We felt very safe here, with constant presence of the doorman and reception staff/concierge, and doorkey operating the lift. Easy to get around, too, with a tram stop literally outside the front door. Soundproofing must have worked; we couldn't even hear the New Year fireworks in the nearby Leidseplein (the Dutch go crazy for New Year in keeping with the party spirit of the place), which went on well into the night. Comfy beds, choice of pillows, subtle lighting with dimmer in bathroom -nice for relaxing soak after sightseeing - with lovely smellies provided. I believe there was a late-riser breakfast which our friends enjoyed in the restaurant, but with 24h room service, who needs to get up! We found the reception and bar staff unfailingly courteous and genuine, and unusually for a 5 star hotel, bar prices don't seem to be artificially raised to catch the tourist dollar/pound. Recommended - but please don't all book at once, I want there to be a room available for me when I return!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine - every thing you would expect and good location. HOWEVER, when it came to depart I wanted to book two places on the shuttle bus to the airport for 22 euros. The concierge suggested taking a taxi - as it was only 20 euros. We did. Upon arrival at the airport, we were charged the 'meter' price - about 35 euros. It was all very sad. The police became involved. But we had to pay up. A misunderstanding, or a con? I think definitely the latter. Just something to bare in mind guys!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - I recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: hkstewart
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel back in August with my boyfriend and we were there for 3 nights. The hotel was lovely and in an excellent location. The staff were friendly and even let us check out of our room at 2pm so we could have more sight seeing time. Also, having the option to have breakfast as late as 12pm is a bonus so no need to drag yourself out of bed early with a hangover! My only gripe was the room and I wished I had asked to be moved. It was probably the smallest room you could cram a double bed into due to its position in the building and the view was of the air conditioning unit!! So when said boyfriend broke the air conditioning dial (god knows how he managed that), having the window open in the middle of August was some what impossible due to the noise of the air conditioning unit!!! If you get room 706, ask to be moved!!! The room itself was spotless and tastefully decorated. If you are one of those people who likes freebies such as shampoos etc, you will be pleased at the amount of complimentary stuff they leave. I would consider the prices to be reasonable and that this hotel to be our equivalent of 4*. Apart from the dodgy view from the room and the size of it, we couldn't fault it. Would definitely return, but not to room 706!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay, was never bothered, safe entry to hotel, must need a key to get to elevator...(safety is a plus) hotel screened my calls for me, If they didn't know my name and room # they couldn't get through. Hotel staff is very friendly as well as the Housekeeping( had a J and great conversation with the Housekeepers when they were cleaning. I recommend this hotel to not just anyone, but everyone

Reviews.Title: “a little expensive but great staff & centrally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed mid-october 2004 two nights weekend break. as per previous review had small interior facing room that i agree was on the small side, however was very comfortable. mini-bar too expensive to use but useful for keeping things cool. ice machine on each floor was helpful. hotel staff where five star, rooms three star although we paid four star price. centrally located with authentic Irish bar Tig Barra just round the block. highly recommended & would return if at the right price i.e E100 per night or less.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the NH Amsterdam Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travel_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a quick weekend trip to Amsterdam and stayed at the NH Amsterdam Centre Hotel. The hotel was terrific; the rooms, though small, have recently been renovated and are nicely appointed with all the necessary comforts. The best part of the room, however, is the bathroom and, in particular, the shower. They have dual shower heads and the pressure is so great you may never want to leave! The location of the hotel is great and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: bikiniamber
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in September 2004. Rooms are very well decorated and well equipped. Hotel is not in the very centre of the city but everything is within walking distance and museums are very close by, so its quite a good location to explore the sights from. However, don't expect a 5* - there's nothing too special about this hotel. Having said that, if you get this at a decent price (say, under â‚¬150), you can't go wrong. I'd certainly stay again. Warning to those who suffer back problems: be very careful, our matress was far too soft.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: David at 4a
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Sep 2004. The restraunt was being refurbished and I guess this is the final phase of a major upgrade. The location is very convienient and this hotel is large comfortable and security concious. The Indonesian restaurant next door is seriously indulgent.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: superhols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 23-25 2004. Loved the rooms, which, although small, were refurbed to a top class standard, with wooden floors, comfortable beds, Grohe fittings and limestone floors and walls in the bathroom....felt like the lap of luxury! The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, even lending us an umbrella when we needed one :) It's just off Leidesplein (tram routes 1, 2 and 5 from the station) which means you're looking at a 15-20 minute walk to more central places, but we still loved the upmarket location near all the fancy shops and museums. I have only *not* given it 5 stars because the refurbishment is still ongoing, and although they told us about it when we got there, we were still woken at 8.30am by heavy drilling. This was okay for us, being on Euro time already, but I imagine it wouldn't be so good if you'd flown in on the red-eye from NYC and were still on East Coast time.... Having checked on this site before booking any of the major hotels in Amsterdam, this was the only hotel with a consistently good review history, and deservedly so. You won't regret it! Make sure you ring and ask whether the renovations have finished though if you're going to book and think it might bother you.

Reviews.Title: “I want one of their beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! Friendly and helpful staff, wonderful, clean environment, and the beds are to die for! I wanted one of their beds to take home with me! Once you fall asleep, you will have trouble getting up! Wonderful hotel; highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nataliehix
Reviews.Content: I booked this through my travel agent and managed to get a great discount, but they did noy inform the hotel that we wanted a smoking room. When we got there, they did not have any smoking rooms left. They upgraded us, free of charge, to the suite. This was just magical, with two bathrooms, in one of which was a triple jacuzzi!! Both had showers too. I was blown over!!! The staff where quite friendly, but i found a number of unfriendly people across the city, but then again, it is a city, and the people where better than the hotel in London I stayed at!! Over all a great experience, and i loved feeling a million dollors, staying in a fancy hotel. The decor was beautifully done, and it was pure luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: snickyla
Reviews.Content: Traveled alone on my first trip to Amsterdam. So safety and a good central location were key. The location of this hotel is great and the room was clean and newly renovated, although average size (small by American standards but fine for Europe). Room service food was not great. The front desk employees were helpful and the concierge was fabulous. I would definitely stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: NH Amsterdam Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Stadhouderskade 7, Amsterdam 1054 ES, The Netherlands
